story:
Sharks are essential for a healthy marine ecosystem. As a keystone species, they keep ocean life balanced and productive. Killing them to extinction is not only a cruel threat to them, it is also a thread to all of us. No sharks = no marine life.

For years, many NGOs have been working in different ways to protect sharks. SILENCE OF THE SHARKS will combine their forces by bringing them together. Through a mass dive that will break any prior record, we will raise awareness of the situation to a whole new level.

    

SILENCE OF THE SHARKS is a non-profit organization founded by David Pilosof (AKA Pilo), a diving veteran with over 30 years of experience in underwater activities all over the world, and supported by many individual believers and leading dive organizations.

Pilo: "It hit me 3 years ago, when I took my first grandson to show him sharks in an underwater observatory. Holding him in my arms, I educated him with a few fun facts. At the same time, I realized he will quite likely never be able to see these amazing creatures in their natural environment. If the killing continues, sharks will end up as a memory of past generations."           

That was just the trigger. Pilo begun exploring the problem. He tried  to learn about the current efforts taken to prevent this horrible scenario and what it means if we do not succeed.

The good news:

  • There are hundreds of organizations all over the world, backed by tens of thousands of activists, all committed to solve this ecological disaster. That means: Many people care.

The bad news:

  • We are still losing and losing big! To date, as a result of overfishing and also by destroying their habitats, only ~20% percent of shark species have managed to survive.
  • During the five minutes it took you to read to this point, 700 more sharks have been killed.

The worst news:

  •  This effects everyone! Not only divers or tree-hugging activists. This effects all of us. Being a top predator, sharks are extremely important. They keep the marine ecosystem in balance.

And, this is not just a guessing game. There is already evidence of the impact a loss of sharks can have on an ecosystem. According to Shark Savers, a scientific study conducted in the mid-Atlantic part of the US, showed that when 11 species of sharks were nearly eliminated, 12 of the 14 species those sharks once fed on became so plentiful that they damaged the ecosystem, including wiping out the species farther down the food chain on which they preyed. The negative effects trickle out as the ecosystem gets thrown out of balance."

To change this reality, one of the biggest challenges we need to overcome is being heard by the masses — not only by those who are already convinced. It is necessary to be heard on prime time news and all over the internet, not only in the environmental section.

Therefore SILENCE OF THE SHARKS will hold a never seen before event, which will:

  • Inform and educate people all over the world that sharks are not a soup delight. They are prehistoric, evolutionary-perfect creatures which the ocean’s life - and therefore everyone - is depending on.    
  • Unite activists, scientists, politicians, influencers of all kind, and passionate people to transfer their know-how and come up with a plan that will be sustained after the event.

Beside the shark conference, the highlight and heart of SILENCE OF THE SHARKS will be a live broadcasted protest dive.

More than 500 divers from all over the world will take part. This dive, both technologically and logistically challenging, might end up with a Guinness World Record. This will fuel our message and cause and give it an even louder voice.

Dr. Sylvia Earle, one of the most famous marine biologists and explorers in the world, had already confirmed her participation. During the broadcast, Sylvia will be attending the dive site while holding a live conversation with some of the most influential leaders in the world. 

While we are setting up this campaign more and more influencers from all over the world are giving their commitment to attend SILENCE OF THE SHARKS as well.  

Beside the protest dive and conference we are organizing protest and awareness dives in many countries and 'recruiting' the next generation of shark lovers by asking children to give sharks their voice. Already hundreds of touching art pieces are uploaded on our website. And: There is more to come!

 

Beside thousands of hours of volunteering work and even more money spent from private pockets, there is still a large gap we need to close to achieve our mission. 

Our biggest challenge is spreading the word about the event: The success of SILENCE OF THE SHARKS depends on the exposure we manage to get. The more exposure, the louder our voices for the sharks. Therefore, great efforts will be invested in the promotion and converge of the event. Crowdfunding is the most effective way of getting heard and the word out.

We need:

  • 40 % will be invest to promote the event and bring awareness through: TV, radio, press, social media etc.
  • 20 % for technical equipment, e.g. cameras, drones, cases
  • 15 % go directly to the sharks conference for inviting and hosting special guests
  • 15 % are spend to organize the event
  • 10 % for safety and security activities that includes divers, guests, crew and volunteers

So please skip a couple coffee Lattes and invest a few bucks into our future. 

Official certificate of recognition 

For your contribution to the campaign you will receive a digital certification signed by Meir Yitzhak Halevi, Mayor of Eilat and David Pilosof, producer of SILENCE OF THE SHARKS.

                

High Resolution panorama photo of the D-DIVE

We are proud to have the brilliant panoramic photographer Nicolas Barraqué on board. His best photo, taken during the D-Dive, will be an awesome memory of the world's biggest protest dive and your contribution. 

Shark poster by artist Shlomo Cohen

Shlomo Cohen is a well known caricaturist and cartoonist. His work is marked by a realistic and unique style. Shlomo is considered as a pioneer of working with the digital pen and a much sought-after speaker in this field. We are grateful that he is a supporter of SILENCE OF THE SHARKS from the very beginning. He not only designed the logo statue of our project he also contributes this amazing shark poster (50x70 cm). It comes as a fine art print in best quality.

Statue SILENCE OF THE SHARKS

The official campaign logo of SILENCE OF THE SHARKS represents the unique style of Shlomo Cohen. The first original 3D statue was printed by Massivit 3D Printing Technologies Ltd and made of dimengel. 

The original 3D print (size 90 x 97 x 110 cm) was used during the first protest dive in Eilat in 2015. It is the biggest perk (in any sense) we offer. However, his 'little brother' comes in 12 x 12 cm (made of resin and a silver painted overall shading) and is available for all shark lovers and activists. We pack it with lots of love in hard cardboard box and secure it with polyfoam fill.

Signed fine art print by Pascal Lecocq

Pascal Lecocq – the painter of blue says about himself: "I always have my head in the clouds, and painting permits me to create an imaginary universe between outer space and the depth of the oceans. (...)  The transposition of reality into an underwater world generates some humor, but hides more meanings." Therefore Pascal is a perfect partner for our mission and with your contribution you will be the owner of his amazing art piece "The Matador". It comes as fine art print (50 x 70 cm) and personally signed by Pascal.   

A seat on the D-DIVE

Be one of 500 divers who are giving sharks their voice. We reserved a limited amount of seats for all shark activists. You will join us on October, 22nd in Eylat and make the D-DIVE remarkable. You want to go after another perk, but be on the D-DIVE as well? No worries! You can save your seat and register here: www.silenceofthesharks.org But please hurry up, as the seats are strictly limited.

Signed XXL-print by Amos Nachoum  

Amos Nachoum, president of BigAnimals Expeditions is an explorer, guide, genius photographer and wildlife lover. His photos and essays have appeared in hundreds of publications around the globe, including National Geographic, Time, Life, The New York Times, Le Figaro, Der Spiegel, Unterwasser, and many more. As a shark evangelist you get one of his best shark shots. It comes in XX-large scale 2 x1.2 meters, printed on aluminum and personally signed by Amos. This perk is truly a great treasure and reserved to only 5 contributors.

Give sharks your voice by:

  • Sharing this page with your family, friends, and everyone you know - simply use any of the share buttons just below the campaign video. 
  • Being an active part of the solution and  joining the event and/or conference – click here to register for the D-Dive: www.SILENCEOFTHESHARKS.org 
  • Following us on social media! Join us now and follow our mission and progress on facebook, YouTube and visit our website.
  • Telling people it is important to save sharks
  • Organizing a protest dive in your country.
  • Encouraging your kids to give sharks their voice by entering our children's competition. 
  • Talking to us - we would love to hear your feedback! (info@silenceofthesharks.org)

"Sharks are beautiful animals, and if you're lucky enough to see lots of them, that means that you're in a healthy ocean. You should be afraid if you are in the ocean and don't see sharks." 

Sylvia Earle

story:
The Expedition Outline

We are a team of 10 bioscience students from the Exeter and Plymouth University  and Photography Students from Falmouth University travelling to the South-East coast of Madagascar to perform biodiversity studies on the fauna found there. We will be heading out in the beginning of August 2017 for 6 weeks.

Madagascar has been isolated from mainland Africa for over 88 million years; resulting in both high species richness and a significant proportion of endemic species.

Our study site, Loholoka, is a coastal humid forest located 600km from the capital, Antananarivo. Currently, the site has no conservation status and so the area is not protected.

Our aim is to follow up the first comprehensive biodiversity record of the Loholoka forest. Our predecessors’ initial biodiversity survey of this poorly researched area provided evidence of a total of 94 species in the Loholoka forest including 11 Mammals (4 Lemurs), 60 Birds, 12 Reptiles and 11 Amphibians. Of these, 8 were listed as either ‘Vulnerable’ or ‘Endangered’ by the IUCN! This project will allow the establishment of long term conservation of the biodiversity of Loholoka.

Additionally, we hope to sample the frogs we collect on surveys for chytrid fungus (Batrachochytrium dendrobatidis), "the worst infectious disease ever recorded among vertebrates in terms of the number of species impacted, and its propensity to drive them to extinction" according to the IUCN. It is responsible for large amphibian die-offs around the world, however it remains relatively absent in Madagascar and the idea of a potential resistance in Madagascan frogs has been suggested. However, studies have been few and far between and its presence on the island has been recently reported by ZSL. We would like to make sure of its presence in the region of Loholoka to start combating it.

 

 

Collaboration

We will be collaborating with students from the University of Antananarivo's Botany and Animal Biology Departments, Government Authorities and working closely with Development and Biodiversity Conservation Action for Madagascar (DBCAM) a small Madagascan research NGO who take a grass roots focus when working with local communities.

Through our in-country contacts we are hoping to encourage more student led projects in Madagascar. In addition these strong collaborations will ensure our findings can be used appropriately in Madagascar once we have returned to the UK. 

 

Why It Matters 

The world is in a biodiversity crisis which it is estimated that the current species extinction rate is between 1,000 and 10,000 times higher than it would naturally be.

In Loholoka the story is no different, a number of threats to biodiversity have been flagged, namely illegal logging and charcoal production. With your help our research would play a significant role in determining the biodiversity status of the area and the fragility of the species present. Without these vital surveys endangered species may go unprotected furthermore new species maybe lost before they are identified. From 1999 to 2010, scientists discovered 615 new species in Madagascar, including 41 mammals and 61 reptiles. 

 

How You Can Support Us 

This project is costing us £12,000 and alongside our personal contributions, we need your help to raise £7,000! 

Your contribution will go towards our in-county costs, ranging from: 4WD vehicles (the terrain is tough!), local guides, scientific equipment hire, food and allowing us to document everything through the use of film and photography.

 

Perks

We have a variety of perks on offer when you make your contribution. Don't forget, what ever amount you donate, you can take a pick from any of the perks within your price range.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

The more support we get the better so get involved and spread the word! 

You can find us here:

Website: Fxpeditions Loholoka

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/projectloholoka2017/

Twitter: https://twitter.com/PLoholoka

 

Thanks from all the team and we will be forever grateful!

story:
Campaign Completion

A very big thank-you to all who supported Newtecpoly’s Sea Trash to See Treasure campaign!!  While it is clear we finished short of our funding target for the full upgrade, Newtecpoly is committed to:

  • Putting the funds raised from this campaign towards a simplified upgrade at our Moama site; and
  • Honouring our commitment to supply the Indiegogo Perks for each backer of the campaign.

Below is a photo of the modifications as part of the simplified upgrade we have begun. We remain excited about the PolyWaste technology, and the immense potential benefits the technology offers the world.

Extruder before cooling elements added.

 

Extruder after cooling elements added.

 

We’ll keep you posted regarding the timing of the perk deliveries, as well as progress of some exciting new trials we have planned for the coming months.

 

Thank-you again to you all for backing the Sea Trash to See Treasure campaign, for your generousity, and trust in us, and believing in a better way of recycling waste plastics. The combination of your support and our commitment will make this exciting opportunity a reality.

 

Short Summary

Newtecpoly is a young company with access to a brilliant new and absolutely unique plastic recycling technology that can deal with contaminated and mixed waste plastics, both hard and soft. Through extensive R&D effort we know the unique mix and melt capability works.  In our pilot testing we’ve even produced a bench, now located at Noosa, from plastic waste collected from the beach! See our video of the process below.

Currently we can mould the planks manually, but this process is slow and super expensive. In order to make our intended huge and positive impact on the environment we need to make it faster and cheaper by upgrading the process.  We know what to do, we just need the funds for the necessary equipment and to upgrade the machinery.

Newtecpoly is seeking your support to raise these funds for the equipment upgrade. This will help clean-up marine debris and convert potentially tonnes of beach waste plastic into useful products,  just like the beach bench we made, now in Noosa.

We need $200,000 for the equipment upgrade. For the moulding equipment itself and the installation at our factory in Moama, New South Wales, Australia.

 

Acknowledgements

Newtecpoly would like to acknowledge all of the effort, support, and camaraderie of various like-minded organisations actively seeking solutions to the problem of waste plastic in our environment.  They include:

 

  • Surfrider Foundation Australia
  • Plastic Police® Partnerships
  • Ocean Crusaders
  • Plastic Pollution Solutions
  • Moodie Outdoor Products
  • Tangaroa Blue
  • NSW Office of Environment and Heritage
  • Advitech Pty Ltd
  • Upcycle the Gyres Society
  • Ellen MacArthur Foundation

The Impact

Ocean Waste Plastic is a huge problem. Here’s some quick facts about Ocean Plastic:

Did you know:

  1. Statistics from a leading environmental authority, Tangaroa Blue, show that 76% of items collected on Australian beaches are plastic.
  2. That there’s an area of waste plastic in the Pacific Ocean termed the Great Pacific Garbage Patch, that is estimated to be 20,000,000 square kilometres. Making bigger than Queensland, Australia or Texas, USA! http://www.nationalgeographic.org/encyclopedia/...
  3. If we don’t change our ways, it’s projected that by 2050 the volume of plastic waste in our oceans will be equal to the weight of all the marine life! Page 14, World Economic Forum report The New Plastics Economy http://www3.weforum.org/docs/WEF_The_New_Plastics_Economy.pdf
  4. 32% of our plastic packaging misses the collection process and finds its way into our water systems and eventually into our oceans. (Page 14, World Economic Forum report The New Plastics Economy)

Above: a waterway clogged with plastic waste in a developing city

Above: an Albatross chick killed by ocean plastic - Midway Island

 

The Ellen MacArthur Foundation has recently released - The New Plastics Economy report:

https://www.ellenmacarthurfoundation.org/news/n...

With a great deal of international support by business leaders:

https://www.ellenmacarthurfoundation.org/news/i...

This is an excellent strategy for tackling the waste plastics problem, basically shown as:

Newtecpoly fully supports this strategy, wanting to see worldwide:

1) A reduction in disposable plastic products;

2) Of the plastic products already made, more made with reusable design; and

3) More ways of recycling waste plastic that weren't achievable before.

Newtecpoly can support part 3 above and can recycle plastic waste that was never before possible.

 

Imagine what the implications of this might be for a world drowning in a sea of plastic waste?!  (See the 7 year old film clip Ghana’s Plastic Waste Menace at https://vimeo.com/12034438 to perhaps gain a better understanding of the scale of the plastic waste crisis we all now face).

 

What We Need & What You Get

Of course, Newtecpoly is not able to solve the world's waste plastic problem alone. But you can help us complete our upgrade goal which will then allow us to show the world what is possible.

To do this we are seeking your support to increase the efficiency of our process. This will make it easier to convert ocean waste into lots of useful products. Like outdoor furniture at the beaches from where the waste was collected.

We need $200,000 for the upgrade. To buy and install a rotary moulding machine, as well as related moulding equipment to increase production efficiency.

How will these funds be spent?

The $200k capital raised would be utilised as follows:

  • Estimated capital cost of the rotary moulding carousel - $130k
  • Cost of freight and delivery - $4K
  • Cost of installation including programming, wiring, etc - $12k
  • Cost of integration with PolyWaste melter and extruder operations - $14k
  • Final commissioning - $10k
  • Rewards for donors - $20k
  • Indiegogo campaign fee - $10k

If the campaign can't raise the target funds, we'll do our best to get close to our project goals, but it obviously depends on how close we get. At the close of the campaign we will send out an update about how we will spend the raised funds, maintaining (where possible)  our original aim of increasing efficiency and reducing plastic waste.

 

Risks & Challenges, and Our Confidence In The Outcomes

Newtecpoly is the existing licensee of the new and exciting PolyWaste technology.  We are the first business to use this technology, so success is extremely important to show the world that plastic waste, especially in our oceans, can be cleaned up. Not just moved to landfill! You can find out more about us here (and watch the PolyWaste video):
http://newtecpoly.com.au/

Peter Barker and Colin Barker are brothers, who along with Michael Ritchie are steering Newtecpoly, dedicated to realising the dream of the inventor and founder Ross Collins, who recently passed away in August 2016.

 

Newtecpoly is justifiably confident from our trials, that we can mix, melt and deliver molten plastic of almost any composition. We've shown this by the bench made of waste collected from our beaches, using co-mingled and contaminated waste plastic. We know we can make a range of useful products, such as outdoor furniture, raised garden beds, and more.

But this is a new technology, and while it has many suitable applications, it has to make sense financially. This includes collection and transport. It has to be a sustainable activity. It needs to be scalable, with widespread adoption our ultimate goal as this will have the biggest impact.

We are confident that we can produce all the perks, and keep track of the amount of waste collected. Then we know how much new plastic product we've kept out of the ecosystem. The timing for upgrading the production line is probably the hardest to control, as we have some tasks that rely on earlier tasks being completed first. We have identified these as potential bottlenecks or critical project paths.

We have a strong project management plan. With over 35 years of industry experience our team are well placed to handle any unforeseen issues that may arise.

Project Timeline

 

Here are some of the results of Newtecpoly’s trials and R&D projects using PolyWaste technology and manual moulding techniques:

 

The Plastic Police® Partnerships program has delivered first class furniture to Biddabah Public School made from the soft plastic wastes collected by the school community since August 2015.  See more at http://www.theherald.com.au/story/4276669/one-of-a-kind-venture/.

Above: Plastic waste collected from Biddabah Public School (NSW, Australia)      

Above:  The outdoor bench produced from the Biddabah waste.

 

The 2016 Beach Clean-Up at Double Island Point in Queensland Australia

This beach clean up yielded sufficient soft and hard plastic waste for us to produce a park bench now located on the beach front at Noosa. We thank and congratulate the Surfrider Foundation and all those dedicated supporters who participated in this beach clean-up, including many participants who attend every year! Follow the link to see the Surfrider Foundation’s 2015 Double Island Point event at:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IRp4xu274qE.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't have the means to contribute, please spread the word about our fantastic project. The more successful this project is, the cleaner our beaches and oceans will be, as well as reducing the creation of new plastic.

Please share our project through your social media links, where you can and we'll keep you updated on our campaign, and our progress! Thanks!

 

Call to action!

Newtecpoly is excited about the potential applications for the PolyWaste technology, both in Australia and around the globe.  Help us, we seek to really ‘make a difference’ in reshaping the management of plastic waste by fully utilising its value as a resource.

Wouldn’t it be good if:

  • The plastic debris on the beaches and in the ocean could be turned into useful products? By providing a use for all waste plastics, a bounty is placed on plastic in the environment.

  • This could lead to appropriate infrastructure in each region and facilitate the development of systems to utilise the plastic resource, particularly in developing countries.

We have an established track record in demonstrating the technical capabilities of the PolyWaste technology. This is based on the manufacture of furniture from the October 2016 beach clean-up at Double Island Point in Queensland and through working with the Plastic Police® Partnerships program.  However, further upgrades are needed at Newtecpoly’s Moama facility in order to increase efficiency of the process.

Ultimately, more sites may be needed in each region rather than transporting all of the waste to Moama.  Demonstrating the feasibility of operation at Moama will be the final step in showing the world there is a better way to manage plastic as a resource.
 

Help us to demonstrate a better way and make massive global change.  Beyond that, only our imaginations are limiting us.

 

Stretch Goals

If the current campaign of $200,000 is successful, Newtecpoly’s further plans for manufacture of products from waste plastic will be brought forward.

These plans include not restricting ourselves to beach clean-ups. With the success of this campaign, we would recycle and manufacture products from many locations around Australia irrespective of its origin. Such as waste collected from Clean Up Australia Day.

Ultimately our thinking is that we need to make it cost effective to recycle all plastic wastes, to minimise pollution to the environment. It would be like placing a bounty upon it! 

 

While it depends on how much we raise, any amounts over our target would be used for Newtecpoly’s further development plans, stepwise, this is:

  • Extra 0 to $60k: Any amounts over our target would be used for processing more plastic waste (and recording how much and where from, for the benefit of supporters).
  • Extra $60k+: Purchase of calibrator equipment for the manufacture of different extruded products and profiles.The cost of an additional calibrator set will be approximately $60k per additional product to be manufactured.
  • Over $1M: (we can dream can't we!): Installation of a further processing line at Moama to manufacture additional products.The cost of an additional melter and full production line will be approximately $1M.
  • Over $3M:(still dreaming, but you might want to know) Establish a new site on the Eastern seaboard of Australia.

As you can see, there is no shortage of opportunity to fully utilise all unused plastic resource if the current funding campaign target were exceeded (or smashed).

 

Environmental Impact

(Technical Stuff for those that are interested in that kind of thing)

A Life Cycle Assessment (LCA) was completed by Newtecpoly with the support of the NSW Office of Environment and Heritage. This LCA demonstrates the impact of producing plastic products compared to both new plastic and current recycling processes.

 

The results show that:

  • The Newtecpoly recycled plastic is less than 10% of the embodied energy of new plastic material and less than 25% of the embodied energy of other recycled plastics (Figure 1); and
  • The Newtecpoly recycled plastic has less than 2% of the carbon emissions associated with production of new plastic products (Figure 2).

Figure 1

Figure 2
story_txt:
Campaign Completion
A very big thank-you to all who supported Newtecpoly’s Sea Trash to See Treasure campaign!!  While it is clear we finished short of our funding target for the full upgrade, Newtecpoly is committed to:

Putting the funds raised from this campaign towards a simplified upgrade at our Moama site; and
Honouring our commitment to supply the Indiegogo Perks for each backer of the campaign.

Below is a photo of the modifications as part of the simplified upgrade we have begun. We remain excited about the PolyWaste technology, and the immense potential benefits the technology offers the world.

Extruder before cooling elements added.
 

Extruder after cooling elements added.
 
We’ll keep you posted regarding the timing of the perk deliveries, as well as progress of some exciting new trials we have planned for the coming months.
 
Thank-you again to you all for backing the Sea Trash to See Treasure campaign, for your generousity, and trust in us, and believing in a better way of recycling waste plastics. The combination of your support and our commitment will make this exciting opportunity a reality.
 
Short Summary
Newtecpoly is a young company with access to a brilliant new and absolutely unique plastic recycling technology that can deal with contaminated and mixed waste plastics, both hard and soft. Through extensive R&D effort we know the unique mix and melt capability works.  In our pilot testing we’ve even produced a bench, now located at Noosa, from plastic waste collected from the beach! See our video of the process below.
Currently we can mould the planks manually, but this process is slow and super expensive. In order to make our intended huge and positive impact on the environment we need to make it faster and cheaper by upgrading the process.  We know what to do, we just need the funds for the necessary equipment and to upgrade the machinery.
Newtecpoly is seeking your support to raise these funds for the equipment upgrade. This will help clean-up marine debris and convert potentially tonnes of beach waste plastic into useful products,  just like the beach bench we made, now in Noosa.
We need $200,000 for the equipment upgrade. For the moulding equipment itself and the installation at our factory in Moama, New South Wales, Australia.
 
Acknowledgements
Newtecpoly would like to acknowledge all of the effort, support, and camaraderie of various like-minded organisations actively seeking solutions to the problem of waste plastic in our environment.  They include:




 

Surfrider Foundation Australia
Plastic Police® Partnerships
Ocean Crusaders
Plastic Pollution Solutions
Moodie Outdoor Products
Tangaroa Blue
NSW Office of Environment and Heritage
Advitech Pty Ltd
Upcycle the Gyres Society
Ellen MacArthur Foundation

The Impact
Ocean Waste Plastic is a huge problem. Here’s some quick facts about Ocean Plastic:
Did you know:

Statistics from a leading environmental authority, Tangaroa Blue, show that 76% of items collected on Australian beaches are plastic.

That there’s an area of waste plastic in the Pacific Ocean termed the Great Pacific Garbage Patch, that is estimated to be 20,000,000 square kilometres. Making bigger than Queensland, Australia or Texas, USA! http://www.nationalgeographic.org/encyclopedia/...

If we don’t change our ways, it’s projected that by 2050 the volume of plastic waste in our oceans will be equal to the weight of all the marine life! Page 14, World Economic Forum report The New Plastics Economy http://www3.weforum.org/docs/WEF_The_New_Plastics_Economy.pdf

32% of our plastic packaging misses the collection process and finds its way into our water systems and eventually into our oceans. (Page 14, World Economic Forum report The New Plastics Economy)


Above: a waterway clogged with plastic waste in a developing city

Above: an Albatross chick killed by ocean plastic - Midway Island
 
The Ellen MacArthur Foundation has recently released - The New Plastics Economy report:
https://www.ellenmacarthurfoundation.org/news/n...
With a great deal of international support by business leaders:
https://www.ellenmacarthurfoundation.org/news/i...
This is an excellent strategy for tackling the waste plastics problem, basically shown as:

Newtecpoly fully supports this strategy, wanting to see worldwide:
1) A reduction in disposable plastic products;
2) Of the plastic products already made, more made with reusable design; and
3) More ways of recycling waste plastic that weren't achievable before.
Newtecpoly can support part 3 above and can recycle plastic waste that was never before possible.
 
Imagine what the implications of this might be for a world drowning in a sea of plastic waste?!  (See the 7 year old film clip Ghana’s Plastic Waste Menace at https://vimeo.com/12034438 to perhaps gain a better understanding of the scale of the plastic waste crisis we all now face).
 

What We Need & What You Get
Of course, Newtecpoly is not able to solve the world's waste plastic problem alone. But you can help us complete our upgrade goal which will then allow us to show the world what is possible.
To do this we are seeking your support to increase the efficiency of our process. This will make it easier to convert ocean waste into lots of useful products. Like outdoor furniture at the beaches from where the waste was collected.
We need $200,000 for the upgrade. To buy and install a rotary moulding machine, as well as related moulding equipment to increase production efficiency.
How will these funds be spent?
The $200k capital raised would be utilised as follows:

Estimated capital cost of the rotary moulding carousel - $130k
Cost of freight and delivery - $4K
Cost of installation including programming, wiring, etc - $12k
Cost of integration with PolyWaste melter and extruder operations - $14k
Final commissioning - $10k
Rewards for donors - $20k
Indiegogo campaign fee - $10k

If the campaign can't raise the target funds, we'll do our best to get close to our project goals, but it obviously depends on how close we get. At the close of the campaign we will send out an update about how we will spend the raised funds, maintaining (where possible)  our original aim of increasing efficiency and reducing plastic waste.

story:
High Efficiency Filtration--Fresh Water for Urban Farming

                                            

A cost effective system to remove contaminants from storm water run off and prevent sewage releases.  System is compact and can be integrated into storm drainage to protect your community's ecosystem.

_____________________________________________________________________________

Over the past two years, we developed a system to better treat non-potable water for urban agricultural use. We have planned this system to specifically meet the needs of urban farming communities and are now going to build our first pilot scale system.  For this, we need your help!

What can the High Efficiency Filter Do?

This filter eliminates Total Suspended Solids (TSS) larger than 2 microns. This is far more effective than common sand or media filters. Our innovative chemical free approach is extremely energy efficient and requires no added chemicals.  Quite simply, it uses a special separation system to turn cloudy water into clear usable irrigation water.  

Why is Storm Water Filtration Needed? 

Storm water contains contaminants.  These include, dirt from construction sites, fertilizers used on your yard, and salt from the roads.  Prior to reusing or releasing this storm water it needs to be treated.

The Problem

During heavy rainfall, the contaminants are washed into the storm water collection system. 


Many municipalities have combined sanitary sewers.  Both the water from your toilet and the water from the street travel to the treatment plant in the same pipe.  As the picture below shows, during heavy rains the water overloads the collection system and a combination of storm water and sewage is released into public waterways.  



Urban Farming in Detroit!


Detroit is currently undergoing one of the greatest urban infrastructure projects in history.  In order to solve the problem of increasing sewer releases without investing the capital to build a new treatment plant, the community has decided to build a 120 acre farm in the center of the city on previously blighted land.  This farm, will employ 200 people and use a closed loop water collection system to prevent storm water runoff from entering the sewers.  Partnering with Recovery Park will allow CRI access to resources and funding to further move the project forward.  But, to get to this point we need your help! 

Transforming This                into                       This Farm         

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise $70,000 to cover all necessary costs for the construction and testing which will be used as a benchmark for future advancement.  Building this pilot scale system and conducting tests will allow us to support RecoveryPark and other green infrastructure projects with a full scale 250,000+ gallon per day system.

As a way to thank you, you will receive some of the great perks celebrating water treatment and Detroit's Urban farming efforts (see list of Perks based on support level).  There are two reward tiers to separate community and industrial donors.  Community support is key to our success and we want you to get involved with protecting your ecosystem-please help out!.    Industrial support is for municipalities and corporations looking to pursue a CRI water treatment system.  Consider your donation a written promise of our support to fulfill your needs as well as a discount off the full scale high efficiency filter.  Any and all support is welcome!

Other Applications of HEF

1. Storm Water Filtration – A cost effective system to remove contaminants from storm water run-off and prevent sewage releases.

2. Brackish Water Filtration – With the addition of Coastal Resources proprietary pre-treatment, (currently under development & testing) the HEF provides low cost desalinated water (NaCl<2,000 PPM) which can then be used for irrigation of crops.

3. Water Reclamation – Industrial water reuse. Reclaiming industrial and food processing waste water streams to be reused in industry as well as for golf course and/or farming irrigation.

4. Membrane pre-filter – By removing particulates down to 2 microns the HEF significantly extends the life of membrane filters and reduces energy costs.

5. Invasive Species Barrier – The HEF can be used to filter ship ballast water eliminating the risk of invasive species such as Zebra Mussels.

6. Clarifier post treatment filter –Post HEF chlorination will render the water potable to standards acceptable in many parts of the world. Use of the HEF will reduce the quantity and concentration of chemical treatment required to achieve these results providing a substantial cost savings.

Who We Are

Coastal Resources International, Inc. (CRI) was started by two engineers who are inspired by the opportunity to revitalize our communities through the development of a needed solution to one of the world’s growing challenges, access to fresh water for farming. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word about our work by sharing our Indiegogo funding campaign with your friends, family and co-workers. 

For more technical information, please contact Chuck Irvin at cirvin@c-resources-intl.com.

story:
RENEWABLE ENERGY FROM OCEAN & RIVERS

By helping  tackle climate change and  slow the reliance on pollutant fossil fuels we want to produce clean renewable energy,  with the environment and not against it.

 We need to leave the world in better condition than it is at present.

And we want to make renewable energy at a competitive price.

SOLUTION, our 1MW TIDAL STREAM GENERATOR. It uses the energy of the flowing water and converts it into electricity, at a competitive cost.

 Your support  will help us reach our goal and YOU will become a member of the support team. We have already started the work and invite you along for the journey. Be part of the team that will make a difference.

A proof of concept was successful and patents are in place. This is not a pipe dream but a viable option.

You will be happy, excited and proud of this project. Include your community and get involved.

1MW Tidal Stream Generator 

Our units are a semi-submersible design and require about 4 meters of water @ 3 – 4 knots. It has a tube with three sets of feathering blades connected to a common drive shaft that is connected through directional gearing  to the out of the water generator house. The electricity generated is transferred to a baseload supplier or end user by connecting cable. The generator house is above the waterline and accessible at any time. The units are designed to operate in either direction to take up less area. Units are constructed off site and are ready to go as soon as they have been calibrated. Units  generate separately from each other and in a farm configuration the whole farm does not have to be in place to start to produce electricity.

They are cost effective compared to other generators, including fossil fuels.


Environmental Benefits we Address;

As with everything being created today, the environmental impact is very important. Our project has had this concern to the forefront during its creation. That is why we have features like;

The cage over the intake. This cage is modified to suit different locations and particular wild life. Also good to keep out small children and old people.

There are no hydrocarbons below the water line. This means there is no risk of pollution from our units.

We do not dam the water flow, meaning any wildlife wetlands are unaffected and we do not contribute to floods or drought.

We do not change the chemistry of the water(to steam). We can heat the ballast tanks to stop ice forming and keep the water flowing.

We do not impede shipping or fishing.

We run very quiet.

We do not emit C02's or harmful gasses.

We are good looking and pleasant to you eye. We look like another pleasure craft.


Brief history

We have over a number of years built and tested a proof of concept model, which is the size of a Toyota van and weighs about 2 ½ ton empty. Through trial and error we changed and modified things until we were happy. We have become very good at making something from very little. To date we have funded this project ourselves plus with generous free assistance. We supplied some beer which helped. 

Concept Photo's


Our team

Our team, who work part time and unpaid on this project includes;

 Neville Smith: inventor and drive behind the project.  He is the team leader                  and seeks assistance where and when we have extended ourselves.

 Richard Goulter: strengths in engineering, hydraulics, electrical, and                              computers.

 Troy Smith: strengths in design, drawings, overseas construction/                                  fabrication. 

 Yvonne Smith: is the assistant of everything and Neville’s understanding wife.

 Richard Bardrick : works with our marketing an social media.


SHORT TERM GOALS:

# build and test pilot sized tidal generator.

# on going patent work.

# publish the test results.

Goals

Progress to Date



Build unit

units will take about 15 to 20 weeks to construct 


Testing will take 52 to 156 weeks.

Patent

USA. China. Australia.  

 More going through the process.

Test results

Proof of concept good, 

Future goals

We see our business  first developing our generator to the commercialization stage. We intend to service industrial and base load suppliers on the international stage. And desire to be the preferred choice for tidal and river energy generation.

We see ourselves building a team of specialists to cover all the fields of our operation, which will include R&D, manufacturing, construction, environmental, finances, licensing, maintainance, sales and marketing.

We will  be looking for partnerships and joint ventures, implementing our skills and knowledge to help get our units quickly and affordably into the international market.

We will become a preferred investment for “ GREEN” funds and carbon credits.

We will look to construction using recycled materials. ( plastics).

Plus supply energy in remote locations.

We wish to be responsible for delivering a reduction in carbon emissions and reduce the reliance on fossil fuels and have an effect on climate change.

Use of Funds

Funding will help:

 # Ongoing patent costs;--As they come due.- Budget???

# Test Site;--Identify,  Complete statutory requirements,  Secure site.

    Time frame; 25 weeks.   Budget, $400,000.

# Test Site Facilities;--Workshop, Office, Equipment, Accommodation, Labor, Set           up  costs, Fixed costs, Monitoring.

    Time frame; up to 156 weeks (3 yrs.) Budget $1.5million. 1st year Total $4million       over 3 years.       

# Construction of Unit / Pilot Project;--Design drawings, Materials, Components,           Equipment, Labor.

   Time frame; 20 to 25 weeks.  Budget. $2million.

# Certification;--Independent verification and Certification.

    Time frame; 36 weeks and up to 156 weeks.  Budget $300,000.

# Decommissioning of Testing Site.

   Time frame; Up to 6 weeks.  Budget $250,000..

 # Marketing and Promotion;--Paper media, Website, Social media, Joining group          associations, Site displays and visits, Direct target sales.

    Time frame; Over 156 weeks (3 years)  Budget.$500,000.

We are eligible for government grants and tax incentives

Once we have proved our output ( to an independent) we have indication of financial support to enter the commercialization stage.

DID YOU KNOW?

To date we have self funded and have no debt.

We have our main team in place ready to go.

Our units are about 20 meters / 65ft long with 3 meter dia. tube.

We will have online video for everybody to follow our progress.

We have successfully completed a proof of concept   project.( see pictures).

We have had positive early talks with Queensland university of technology ( Australia) regarding support and cooperation.

We have patents granted in USA. China. Australia.- more are being processed as we speak.

 We  endeavor to supply our generators at a better price per MW. than wind, solar, other tidal's and some coal. This will depend on locations.

We have many environmental features.

To date we have kept a low profile, working part-time from our house on the Gold Coast of Australia. It is now after many years of progress we have to make people aware of us so we can raise funds through crowdfunding to go to the next level.

Our story can be viewed on Youtube under Global Tidal Energy 2nd cut.

We bank with WESTPAC Australia

Rewards:



PERKS AND REWARDS. delivered around 30/40 days after campaign closed.

!!!!CARTOON COMPETITION. $2,000. USD.PRIZE!!!!!

As part of our campaign we have a cartoon competition (free entry)for anybody to enter. Details @ wwwglobaltidalenergy.com

Register your likes on our facebook site. MOST LIKES WINS .

TOP ENTRIES TO DATE.............




CORPORATE SUPPORT/ SPONSORS


Bronze / Silver. / Gold.

Bronze; $2000 USD.

Thanks, we will furnish your company a certificate of appreciation and register your support on our sites.

Silver : $5000 USD.

We will supply a framed certificate of appreciation. Present a cartoon/ charactiture depicting your company and renewables ( which will become part of our cartoon competition). Plus advertising in a major national news paper.( require 50 parties to trigger this pledge).Register your support on our sites.

GOLD. $10000 USD plus.

Framed certificate of appreciation. Signed / framed cartoon depicting your company and renewables.Register your support on our sites.

Prominent advertising in national news paper showing your support. A personal thank-you video. Your company name located on a test generator.

Supporters / Sponsors  please note; company supporters are to forward their company logo by Email to; nandyscartoons@hotmail.com
story_txt:
RENEWABLE ENERGY FROM OCEAN & RIVERSBy helping  tackle climate change and  slow the reliance on pollutant fossil fuels we want to produce clean renewable energy,  with the environment and not against it. We need to leave the world in better condition than it is at present.And we want to make renewable energy at a competitive price.SOLUTION, our 1MW TIDAL STREAM GENERATOR. It uses the energy of the flowing water and converts it into electricity, at a competitive cost. Your support  will help us reach our goal and YOU will become a member of the support team. We have already started the work and invite you along for the journey. Be part of the team that will make a difference.A proof of concept was successful and patents are in place. This is not a pipe dream but a viable option.You will be happy, excited and proud of this project. Include your community and get involved.1MW Tidal Stream Generator Our units are a semi-submersible design and require about 4 meters
of water @ 3 – 4 knots. It has a tube with three sets of feathering blades
connected to a common drive shaft that is connected through directional gearing  to the out of the water generator house. The electricity generated is
transferred to a baseload supplier or end user by connecting cable. The generator house is above the waterline and accessible at any time. The
units are designed to operate in either direction to take up less area. Units
are constructed off site and are ready to go as soon as they have been calibrated. Units  generate separately from each other and in a farm configuration the whole farm does not have to be in place to start to produce electricity.
They are cost effective compared to other generators, including
fossil fuels.
Environmental Benefits we Address;
As with everything being created today, the environmental
impact is very important. Our project has had this concern to the forefront during
its creation. That is why we have features like;
The cage over the intake. This cage is modified to
suit different locations and particular wild life. Also good to keep out
small children and old people.
There are no hydrocarbons below the water line. This
means there is no risk of pollution from our units.
We do not dam the water flow, meaning any wildlife wetlands
are unaffected and we do not contribute to floods or drought.
We do not change the chemistry of the water(to steam).
We can heat the ballast tanks to stop ice forming and keep the water flowing.
We do not impede shipping or fishing.
We run very quiet.
We do not emit C02's or harmful gasses.
We are good looking and pleasant to you eye. We look
like another pleasure craft.Brief
history
We have over
a number of years built and tested a proof of concept model, which is the size
of a Toyota van and weighs about 2 ½ ton empty. Through trial and error we changed
and modified things until we were happy. We have become very good at making something from
very little. To date we have funded this project ourselves plus with generous
free assistance. We supplied some beer which helped. Concept Photo'sOur team
Our team, who work part time and
unpaid on this project includes;
 Neville Smith: inventor and drive
behind the project.  He is the team
leader                  and seeks assistance where and when we have extended ourselves.
 Richard Goulter: strengths in
engineering, hydraulics, electrical, and                              computers.
 Troy Smith: strengths in design, drawings, overseas construction/                                  fabrication.  Yvonne Smith: is the assistant of everything and Neville’s understanding wife.

 Richard Bardrick : works with our marketing an social media.SHORT TERM GOALS:# build and test pilot sized tidal generator.
# on going patent work.
# publish the test results.



Goals


Progress
  to Date












Build unit


units will take about 15 to 20 weeks to construct 







Testing will take 52 to 156 weeks.




Patent


USA.

 More going
  through the process.




Test
  results


Proof
  of concept good, 



Future goals
We see our
business  first developing our generator to the commercialization stage. We intend
to service industrial and base load suppliers on the international stage. And desire
to be the preferred choice for tidal and river energy generation.
We see
ourselves building a team of specialists to cover all the fields of our
operation, which will include R&D, manufacturing, construction,
environmental, finances, licensing, maintainance, sales and marketing.

story: My name is Zach Morrow and i am a fisherman.  I fish in Cabo San Lucas several times a year.  Throughout the years i have met many local captains, mates, and their families.  Although most are not rich and famous with money and media, these are some of the richest and most famous fisherman of all, with all their knowledge, stories and the ability to work hard to catch a perfect stranger a fish of a lifetime. As the stories will surface i know first hand that many of them lost everything they had. Luckily they are mostly safe but they need a lot of help rebuilding.  I am going to go down and help with the efforts and i am looking to raise some money to go directly to the families that need it the most.  They count on tourism as their income and the faster they get re built the easier it is on their families! So from one fisherman to another lets help out Cabo San lucas!!!!

story:
Situated within the Wilson M. Powell Wildlife Sanctuary (Old Chatham, NY), and owned by the Alan Devoe Bird Club, the spillway at Reilly Pond is in need of desperate repair! The pond was constructed in 1967 and is a main feature for waterfowl observation within the sanctuary. With a scheduled start date of repair during the spring of 2015 the Alan Devoe Bird Club is looking to raise the necessary funds to keep the pond vibrant and maintained.

Reilly Pond is an amazing resource and green space for local students, teachers, and families in Columbia County along with numerous outdoor enthusiasts from far and wide. It also provides critical habitat for locally breeding and migratory species of birds along with numerous unique species of plants, insects, amphibians, and mammals. For these reasons the Alan Devoe Bird Club hopes to maintain the pond and the dam for future generations to come.

The ultimate fund raising goal for the repair is $30,000 with a lifetime member of the club matching any funds raised up to $15,000. It is this figure ($15k) that we have set as our goal for the amount of funds to be raised at INDIEGOGO!

We thank you for your time and contributions.

Sincerely,
The Alan Devoe Bird Club

story:
*PARADISE WORTH TAKING CARE OF*

In the Southwest of the Colombian Pacific Coast, are the remote beaches of Juanchacho, Ladrilleros and La Barra.

Only 10 minutes away is the Bahía Malaga (Malaga Bay) National Park. These beautiful beaches are inhabited by people of Afro descendant, indigenous communities, and thousands of unique species not found anywhere else in the world, including the annual migration and birthplace of the humpback whales.Mangrove forests essential to maintaining the ecosystem in balance flourish, and rivers flowing out to the sea surround these majestic bays.

Currently, this region is affected by the excessive accumulation of all kinds of plastic waste that wash up every day with the tide. This problem has been getting worse due the global increase in plastic production and improper waste disposal. This global problem affects corners of the world, such as ours, where there are by default no ways to deal with it.

That is why, from September to December of this year, EcoPazifico has taken the great initiative to visit these beaches offering solutions that will be presented in schools and the community in general.

Through artistic and creative activities, we will share information about the current problems that the planet is facing at an ecological level and we will expose various practical solutions that can be applied according to the needs and culture of the communities. This program is being designed to create a chain of continuous lessons that train the participants; to expand their knowledge, and impart techniques that can be passed on to others.

What We Need & What You Get

We have estimated 25000 euros to begin this first period of our project, that will plant the first seeds in the community.

But to achieve a law enforcement and a proper and intelligent disposal of trash, we will need much more! So Sponsors feeelling called, please get in touch with us!

Your donations for this years ignaguration will be use for:

20 volunteers devoting to this project during 3 months. 

To be able to operate at our maximal potential, the following basics are essential and required to succeed with the project :

* School Supplies 

* Working Tools

* Basic Technical Equipment

* Administration Costs

*Housing and Lodging

For detail information about budget, please go to following website:

www.ecopazifico.org 

and if you prefer to Donate via Bank Transfer here is the option!

Ethik Bank

Germany

Ecopazifico e.V

BIC: GENODEF1ETK

IBAN: DE61830944950003295451

ACCOUNT: 3295451 

GERMAN BANK CODE: 83094495  

The Impact

Building a Cultural Center for the 3 neighbor communities using Earthship biotecture methods,

This center will serve as educational platform with the following functions:

1.Workshop space to learn different arts and disciplines.

2.stage for presentations, lectures and performances.

3. Atelier for inspiration and making upcycled art.

4.Museum to exhibit marine fossils and the amazing art pieces made by the community.

5. Kindergarden, for the local community

6. Permacultural healing garden that unites the spaces.

7.Temple

We are coming to share all the information we have been gathering  for so many years.

Presenting practical solutions that deal creatively with the ocean plastic, and  proposing numerous socio-ecologic solutions that offer alternatives for a healthier lifestyle that balance life between the community and the habitat.

We are currently studying how they can promote their eco-turism offers in a perspective that protects their environment, and also studying wich native species can be cultivated for a fair-trade micro -business.

All this ideas will be presented together with the members and with the facilitators, and we  are confident to find the best most creative ways to achieve it.

Long Term Dreams:   WHY WE NEED SPONSORSHIPS????


1.Inspire action with tangible and immediate results; initiating and maintaining the habitual cleanup of plastic and other detritus from local beaches will provide an obvious contrast and hopefully provide bigger-picture perspective and the inspiration to act on a larger scale.


2.Create an educational chain of learning and teaching;  learning tools, scripts and programming are to be shared and scaled to each unique community.  We will develop and, with each new application, adapt, a full package of manuals, scripts, instructional videos, success testimonials and essential tools that can be applied and executed in diverse communities worldwide.  


3.Create a successful, scaleable model of a plastic-free zone; implementing a grass-roots supported ban of plastic from the beach of Juanchaco is the first step.  Accessing the knowledge, concepts, technology and techniques  the Ecopazifico team has to offer, we are inviting Juanchaco to replace current packaging and utensils with coconut, banana leaf and other natural fibers.  Ecopazifico will introduce machinery to easily transform coconut skin, shells and waste, into fully functional packaging  and “to -go “alternatives.


4.Reach out to the source; submit a viable proposal and attempt to open discourse with the plastic production industry, starting with those producers based in Colombia.  Super economical power alternatives and biodegradable components are becoming more and more available and this, dovetailed with growing public relations and shareholder concerns, will be the focus of the discussion; not only is the ultimately declining petroleum industry facing increasing challenges, but sustainable industry is enjoying more mainstream success every day.


5.Assist the grassroots movement to regulate plastic production, use and disposal;  as the community groundswell for the regulation of plastic results in lobbying for plastics regulation, Ecopazifico will provide the data, materials and support needed to put forth the most compelling case possible to government entities ranging from municipal to federal.

Other Ways You Can Help

if you just cannot contribute, you can help in other ways:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about this campaign, post  the crowd funding link on social media and or send it to all the people you know
  • Donate your old Camaras and laptops to the schools in Juanchaco, ladrilleros and La Barra.  For more info go to www.ecopazifico.org

story:
We are a certified 501(c) Canadian non-profit organization. All donations above $20 receive a tax deduction receipt (In Canada only). 

Alberta Conservation Association (ACA) is raising money to conserve 289 acres of land that welcomes 10% of Alberta's piping plover population.

The cost of the land is $391,000 CDN. So far, we have been successful in raising approximately $220,000 CDN. We are now making our last push to raise the additional $100,000 CDN to make this purchase.

                                              

The majority of Alberta's piping plovers languish on sandy beaches along the Gulf Coast of Texas during the fall and winter. Each spring, they head north to a pebble beach along a saline pond in east-central Alberta.

                                           

By conserving this pocket of plover breeding habitat we can create a permanent sanctuary and protect a large portion of the remaining piping plovers for many generations to come. Let’s make sure they always have a home to return to. 

                                             

This is our plan:

  • Provide regular population monitoring and reports.
  • Install signs that tell everyone about the good we accomplished together.
  • Remove common threats such as unintentional off-road vehicle use.
  • Prevent any human disturbances.
  • Create a peaceful place for piping plover viewing.

                                            

Being not much bigger than your pinky finger and unable to fly for close to a month, how can you say no? Your support is a gift that will have long-term, positive results on an endangered species.

For everyone that gets involved, you will receive updates via our e-newsletter. You’ll hear how the piping plover habitat purchase is going, what we are doing for Starsky and Hatch, and what’s happening on the breeding beaches, along with pictures and short-videos.

As a plover lover, you are welcome to visit thousands of acres that have been conserved for Alberta’s wildlife and fish…anytime, for free.

For the past 15 years, ACA biologists have been monitoring piping plover populations, and working with landowners to protect and enhance habitat. 

Alberta Conservation Association is a not-for-profit conservation organization based in Alberta, Canada (ab-conservation.com/piping plover). We conserve, protect and enhance fish and wildlife populations and their habitats, now and for generations to come.

and Hatch, and what’s happening on the breeding beaches, along with pictures
and short-videos. 
As a plover
lover, you are welcome to visit thousands of
acres that have been conserved for Alberta’s wildlife and fish…anytime, for
free. 
For the past 15 years, ACA biologists have been monitoring piping plover
populations, and working with landowners to protect and enhance habitat.  
Alberta
Conservation Association is a not-for-profit conservation organization based in
Alberta, Canada (ab-conservation.com/piping plover). We conserve, protect and enhance fish and wildlife populations and
their habitats, now and for generations to come.

story:
Thank You! You've helped us get started!

Sprout Guerrilla is a new social purpose business. Our mission is to enable people to engage with urban sustainability in fun and simple ways. Moss graffiti is a great way to make a statement about urban ecology and have fun while greening your space. 

By contributing to this campaign, you've helped us get started. Thank you for your support and generosity! We've begun processing your perks and you'll be receiving updates on perk deliveries soon.

Stay updated on Sprout Guerrilla happenings - sign up for our newsletter here. And visit our website at www.sproutguerrilla.com.

Thanks again!

Julie and the Sprout Guerrilla team.

_______________________________________________________________________

Moss Graffiti Kits, by Sprout Guerrilla - In the News!

        Canada AM: The lowdown on moss graffiti  Julie Forand, founder of Sprout Guerrilla, explains how live moss is being used as wall paint in an effort to turn concrete jungles into environmentally friendly spaces.

"Graffiti in Canada is alive and well. And we do mean alive"

 "OCAD grad wants to cover Toronto in moss graffiti"

_______________________________________________________________________

What is Moss Graffiti?

Moss graffiti (aka, eco-graffiti or green graffiti) replaces spray paint and toxic chemicals with a moss "paint" that can grow into whatever design you shape. Moss graffiti reclaims dead spaces and transforms them into living urban ecologies. 

What's in a Moss Graffiti Kit?

A Sprout Guerrilla Moss Graffiti Kit comes with a dry moss mixture, and all you have to do is add water, paint your moss artwork, and help it grow. 

The mixture is made from moss and all natural ingredients, like powdered buttermilk, which help the moss grow. Painting with moss is a fun and safe activity for use by kids 6 and up.

Examples of Moss Art:

There are lots of ways to be creative with moss graffiti. Here are some examples of moss artworks:

Moss poem, by: Anna-Garforth; Moss animal, by: the real janelle

Moss car, by: Morten Flyverbom; Moss tree, by: Jill Fehrenbacker

About Sprout Guerrilla

Founded on the principles of sustainability and effective environmental design, Toronto-based Sprout Guerrilla seeks to green the world’s urban centres, one blank wall at a time. As part of our “I ♥ my city” campaign, we're inviting urbanites across Canada and the United States to become guerrilla gardeners. Sprout Guerrilla's Moss Graffiti Kits provide all the materials and instructions necessary for you to take up guerrilla gardening and 'paint' or transplant your own moss masterpiece and make your city green with moss.

What We Need:

$25,000 Raw Materials [moss, powdered buttermilk and other natural ingredients, packaging] 

$3500 Start-Up Expenses [incorporation, trademarking, legal fees]

$2000  Website Development [design, coding, hosting]

$5600  Marketing [videography, product photography, press kit, social media]

$1400 Business and Office Expenses [domain fees, storage, office supplies]

$12,500 Staff [administrative assistant, production assistants]

= $50,000 

Our supply and distribution chain is set up. We need funds to begin ordering the materials, and then we can make and ship your perks.

If we raise $50,000 by selling moss graffiti kits alone, that's enough moss art to cover over 2083 sq ft of concrete jungle and absorb emissions of 2896 sq ft of busy road. *see "Why It Matters" below.

Stretch goals: Funds raised in excess of $50,000 will go towards funding community moss wall projects ($6000 spring 2014) and developing the second generation of Moss Graffiti Kit packaging made with seed paper!

Note: This campaign will receive all funds raised, and fulfill all perks even if it does not reach its goal. 

I ♥ My City

The premise of the campaign is simple: moss hearts are “painted” in public spaces, creating an eye-catching synthesis of art and nature. And to make this painting process as easy as possible, we've created a line of just-add-water kits that provide you with all the tools necessary to create their own moss graffiti masterpiece. 

Completely customizable, easy to remove, and ecologically sound, Sprout Guerrilla art is a practical and beautiful way to make a powerful statement about urban ecology.

Why It Matters

Thankfully, Sprout Guerrilla moss graffiti is not only aesthetically beautiful, but  environmentally friendly. It's actually has a positive impact on the environment!

Here's the science:

“A calculation of the absorption of particulate matter by the moss in relation to the exhaustion of particulate matter:

A= Busy road = 14 g/m2 exhaustion of particulate matter per year

B= Moss = 20 g/m2 absorption of particulate matter per year

A/B = 0.7 m2 of moss is needed to neutralise the emissions of 1 m2 of a busy road.

This calculation is based on ideal conditions for the moss.

 (The data used in this calculation are based on a research project from the University of Bonn, led by Biology professor Jan-Peter Frahm, with moss mats on the side of the road. Possible deviations from this data are not excluded.)” Green Facade Design.

* Conversion: 1 m2 = 3.28 ft2 

The organic matter supported by moss graffiti metabolizes airborne pollution (such as CO2 emissions) and creates a permeable organic layer that slows the flow of water and reduces the harmful effects of storm-water runoff. As a result, the urban ecological system is healthier, and, in turn, beneficial to human health and wellness.

Perks!

Moss Graffiti Kit

Sprout Guerrilla Moss Graffiti Kit comes with a dry moss mixture, and all you have to do is add water, paint your moss artwork, and help it grow. The mixture is made from moss and all natural ingredients, like powdered buttermilk, which help the moss grow. Painting with moss is a fun and safe activity for kids 6 and up (use parental discretion).

Each kit contains enough moss mixture to create a 1 sq.ft design. Painting with moss requires care so it can grow and mature into the artwork you created. 

Tips: 

Select the location and surface wisely. Moss can grow on vertical and horizontal surfaces, but the material needs to be porous. Wood, brick, concrete, or dense soil are generally good options. This type of moss (sheet moss) thrives in shade. It can tolerate partial sunlight – but not direct afternoon sun! It also needs to be kept moist in order to grow, so check up on your artwork regularly to spritz it with water if needed.

The best time to 'plant' your moss artwork is in moist seasons, like Fall and Spring. Moss needs a chance to mature before it can survive extreme weather. Once the moss is mature, it can handle harsh weather conditions, even drought. The moss will simply stops growing and become dormant until favourable conditions return.

  • Single Kit @ $24 (Total perk value: $34 incl. taxes and shipping)
  • 3 Kits @ $70 (Total perk value: $89 incl. taxes and shipping)
  • Moss Party/12 Kits @ $275 (Total perk value: $328 incl. taxes and shipping)
  • Classroom Special/24 Kits @ $800 (Total perk value: $1000 incl. taxes and shipping)
  • 50 Kits to Moss My Business @ $1200 (Total perk value: $1500 incl. taxes and shipping)

Greener Shipping Method:

In support of greener transport and local small courier businesses, we're going to use local bike couriers from your city/town to deliver the perks.

For smaller orders we're aiming to have your perks shipped by the end of November. Larger orders will be shipped in the new year. Spring or Fall are the best seasons to make moss art, so you'll get your kits in time for peak moss painting season 2014.

Free shipping for orders within North America.

International Contributions, please add $18 shipping + handling.

Stencils

Don't worry if you're not artistic, we're sending you a stencil with each kit! Whether you stick to the included Sprout Guerrilla stencils, or branch out with your own designs, our kits will help you beautify, and greenify, your community.

Moss Heart Kit

If you would like to join our movement and show your ♥ for your city, order the Moss Heart Kit! This kit comes with a mature moss heart that you can transplant instead of paint. Each kit contains a 1 sq.ft moss heart. The same Tips apply to this kind of moss artwork (see above) , but this method is less messy and takes less time to establish itself onto the surface you chose. 

  • Single Kit @ $24 (Total perk value: $34 incl. taxes and shipping)

Featured Perk

Feature Perk! Includes 3 Moss Graffiti Kits, "You Know You Make Me Wanna Sprout" tote bag, and 3 stickers. It's the only perk with stickers included! 

bag details: 14.5" wide x 15.5" high. Straps and inside pocket. Made with organic cotton canvas. Made in Toronto, Canada: sewn by Pigeons&Thread production studio and screen printed by Peace And Cotton.

Stickers:

            

  • Feature Perk @$98 (Total perk value: $122 incl. taxes and shipping)


"My Green City" Book

"Back to Nature with Attitude and Style," (Editors: R. Klanten, S. Ehmann, K. Bolhöfer)

This book presents inspiring work from around the world that is bringing nature back into our cities. For everyone who has an interest in a more responsible and environmentally friendly lifestyle, this entertaining and socially relevant book makes it clear that we can design our urban future in a way that's green, innovative, vibrant, and constructive.

Classroom Special

Teach your students about the importance of green living. This package includes 24 Moss Graffiti Kits and the "My Green City" book. Sprout Guerrilla speak to the kids about urban gardening and lead a moss art activity. 

Sprout Guerrilla is located in Toronto, Canada, but I can telecommute (or travel to you're classroom far if expenses are paid for separately).

(Total perk value: $1000 incl. taxes and shipping)

Moss My Business

Green your workplace! This package includes 50 Moss Graffiti kits, plus the "My Green City" book, providing you with everything to need for a memorable staff party or team-building session. The kits make great gifts!

(Total perk value: $1500 incl. taxes and shipping)

Custom Packaging Artwork

Want customized kits? If you provide us with a 300dpi jpg file and add $100 perk to your contribution then we can add your logo to one panel on the packaging. This add-on great for the larger perks: 'Moss My Business' or Moss my Community'.

Moss Murals Designed Just For You

Award-winning illustrator Gary Taxali will design a moss mural for you! His style, inspired by vintage comics and advertising art, is repurposed with the goal of communicating the ironies and comical essence of popular culture. 

Design Your Own Moss Mural

If you prefer to make your own moss mural design, we can send you all the materials and framework to make your own moss mural wall hanging. Or, if you prefer, Sprout Guerrilla can facilitate a mural design workshop to help you create your own moss artwork.

This is a great team building exercise and the finished mural make a great wall hanging for your workspace or client lobby. Moss art is sure to start a conversation and inspire!

Email us with desired mural dimensions and we'll create a custom perk for you. info@sproutguerrilla.com

Donate a wall! If you have a blank wall that you would like to fill with a community moss art project, please let us know! 


Other Ways to ♥ Your City

Use the IndieGoGo share tools to spread the word about this campaign and help make it happen!

==================

 

Supported by:                                                                   Founded by a SheEO!                           

                                 


SPROUT GUERRILLA, SPROUT GUERRILLA & DESIGN, and the MOSS HEART DESIGN are trademarks of Sprout Guerrilla. © Sprout Guerrilla 2013.  All Rights Reserved.  Other trademarks and materials are those of their respective owners.
