story:
Ahoy,

 

     Welcome to the Ancient Future Mystery People's Pirate Academy. The AFMPPA is a free and borderless civilization for a new age.  Finally, a new world is growing where people are set free to reach to their natural potential. A place where you can eat and live healthily from an organic permaculture garden, drink rain water, learn to cultivate industrial hemp, and enjoy the tropical Belizean jungle. A place where you can discover more ways to use the wisdom of the past to create the solutions for our future, to learn, teach, build, grow, and work together into this new age.

 

"THE AFMPPA; Changing the world, one Pirate at a time.."

 

We are building a self sustained Eco-symbiotic micro society in the jungles of Belize. We want you to join us.

 

 

 

THE IMPACT

 

      The world of today is suffocated by mans attempts to drag every resource they can out of her. Imagine a society where we live symbiotically with our environment, without living like "cavemen banging sticks together...", where paper, lumber, concrete, fuels, fabric, paints, oils, cosmetics, plastics, flours, and much much more can be grown out of the ground with a zero or negative carbon footprint. Where free energy is the bi-product of our commercial and manufacturing processes and is readily available to everyone.

       

      By putting into use a combination of old wisdoms, and new technologies

(Some technology new due to recent development, some due to years of suppression by political and corporate giants in fear of losing control over the industries that made them wealthy), we can work to create a world where, since People produce everything without the help of the state, Governments will be forced to work FOR a truly independent population, and the power will once again rest in the hands of the People, where it belongs. 

 

      Our goals may be lofty, they may seem unattainable, all our efforts may seem like nothing but droplets in the ocean. But what is an ocean, but a multitude of drops?

 

      We have no illusions of some miraculous overnight change, but a shift is occurring. By taking on our shoulders the task of creating a community society, a free republic that works together towards the aforementioned aims, using ancient techniques and understandings combined with actively putting new technologies and developments in agriculture into practice, The Ancient Future Mystery People's Pirate Academy will become a place people can come to learn, teach, create, build, grow, live and learn free. To become a beacon for progress to inspire others to found other communities bound by the common love of liberty and innovation. 

 

      Once in a while in the stream of life we come across opportunities to become a part of something great in its earliest phase and truly have a hand in its shaping. This is one of those opportunities.

 

      This community is already in development, we have 41 acres of land in a tropical paradise (Belize), we are building treehouses, geodesic domes, aqua/permaculture gardens, earthships, sustainable energy systems, eating coconuts and mangoes, working hard, and changing the world, one pirate at a time.

 

 

WHAT WE HAVE NOW, AND WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR:

 

          We are working hard all day, every day, to build a sustainable living situation for people to come to and stay and work directly with us. And thanks to a cooperative political climate, we are coordinating with several Ministers in government to establish an industrial hemp industry here in Belize. (Among other things to be revealed as they develop on the AFMPPA facebook page.)

 

We have:

 

The land, connections, vision, passion, good luck, balls, and perseverance to make this happen, but all we need is a small amount of initial funding to allow us to make some big moves quickly, and be ready to have you and others come visit.

 

We are looking for: 

 

$1400 to transport two 4x4 trucks to Belize loaded with all the tools, solar panels, and other supplies and equipments needed to speed up the construction phase. (At the moment it's all hand tools and man power).

 

$1000 to buy two 1300 gallon water tanks to store water during the dry season for irrigation and house use. (We can pull water up from a well, but need somewhere to store it for extended periods of time).

 

$3000 to form a non-profit corporation, and register it as an NGO (Non-Governmental Organization) in Belize. 

 

$1000 Food, to feed those helping on the land to build the community structures and gardens etc. (until the gardens begin producing; 4-6 months from end of campaign if successful).

 

$600 for the initial seeds and seedlings to plant our gardens, coconut trees, banana trees, etc...

 

$1000 to hire a tractor to come out and dig our tilapia pond for the aquaculture irrigation system.

 

$1000 to hire some local workers to expedite the clearing of 5 acres to begin preparing the land for cultivating industrial hemp, and pay for the transportation of the first crop of hemp to a state of the art processing location offsite, where our hemp fibre and seeds can be milled down to the micron. 

 

$1000 to buy mosquito netting, and some materials necessary for waterproofing, and weatherproofing the first living structures" so that the initial construction crew can sleep out of the rain, and keep all the tools and gear in a dry safe place. 

 

And by the virtues of indiegogo, if we exceed the amount sought, the possibilities are endless. Before long we could begin acquiring more land into the AFMPPA offshore Trust, to preserve its natural beauty while creating more self sustained living situations, and cultivating more industrial hemp Etc. There is no ceiling. 

 

WHAT YOU GET OUT OF IT:

 

To take part in the birth of a new society and help it grow from a small collective into a worldwide movement. 

 

To have a place to stay in a self sustained eco-community in a tropical paradise. (So long as you do not violate the terms of the  AFMPPA Articles of Agreement.) 

 

To be able to certifiably call yourself a Pirate.

 

Weekly updates on the progress of the projects both on site in Belize, and elsewhere the AFMPPA takes root. 

 

To be able to say things like ... "I was there when...", and..."I was in the Academy before it was cool".

 

NOTE: Just FYI, the exchange rate in Belize is 2:1. That is, $1 USD = $2 BZD.  So all contributions will effectively equal double their ammount here in Belize.  If you can only donate a dollar,  it equals two dollars for us here in Belize. Also, paypal is the most convenient way to contribute. If you have a paypall account, we reccomend using it for these ends. Thank you.

 

 

OTHER WAYS TO TAKE PART:

 

      We are aware that some who wish to join in and become involved may not be in a position to do so financially, but never fear, there there are many other ways contribute. Here's a few:

 

--SPREAD THE WORD

Share the links to the official Facebook page of the Ancient Future Mystery People's Pirate Academy, (www.facebook.com/AFMPPA), and this indiegogo campaign everywhere you can. Talk to anyone you think may be interested in taking part in this great adventure with us. If you want more information or materials to send out, please contact us via our website www.AFMPPA.com

 

--EDUCATE THYSELF

Take some time to learn all you can about your natural rights. Teach, create, build, live, learn, love, and be a force for good wherever you go. Pull back the curtains and look at the brick wall at the back of the theatre. Poke your finger through some of the loose mortar and really see the reality of another world being possible.But most of all...

 

Be free.
story_txt:
Ahoy,
 
     Welcome to the Ancient Future Mystery People's Pirate Academy. The AFMPPA is a free and borderless civilization for a new age.  Finally, a new world is growing where people are set free to reach to their natural potential. A place where you can eat and live healthily from an organic permaculture garden, drink rain water, learn to cultivate industrial hemp, and enjoy the tropical Belizean jungle. A place where you can discover more ways to use the wisdom of the past to create the solutions for our future, to learn, teach, build, grow, and work together into this new age.
 
"THE AFMPPA; Changing the world, one Pirate at a time.."
 
We are building a self sustained Eco-symbiotic micro society in the jungles of Belize. We want you to join us.
 
 
 
THE IMPACT
 
      The world of today is suffocated by mans attempts to drag every resource they can out of her. Imagine a society where we live symbiotically with our environment, without living like "cavemen banging sticks together...", where paper, lumber, concrete, fuels, fabric, paints, oils, cosmetics, plastics, flours, and much much more can be grown out of the ground with a zero or negative carbon footprint. Where free energy is the bi-product of our commercial and manufacturing processes and is readily available to everyone.
       
      By putting into use a combination of old wisdoms, and new technologies
(Some technology new due to recent development, some due to years of suppression by political and corporate giants in fear of losing control over the industries that made them wealthy), we can work to create a world where, since People produce everything without the help of the state, Governments will be forced to work FOR a truly independent population, and the power will once again rest in the hands of the People, where it belongs. 
 
      Our goals may be lofty, they may seem unattainable, all our efforts may seem like nothing but droplets in the ocean. But what is an ocean, but a multitude of drops?
 
      We have no illusions of some miraculous overnight change, but a shift is occurring. By taking on our shoulders the task of creating a community society, a free republic that works together towards the aforementioned aims, using ancient techniques and understandings combined with actively putting new technologies and developments in agriculture into practice, The Ancient Future Mystery People's Pirate Academy will become a place people can come to learn, teach, create, build, grow, live and learn free. To become a beacon for progress to inspire others to found other communities bound by the common love of liberty and innovation. 
 
      Once in a while in the stream of life we come across opportunities to become a part of something great in its earliest phase and truly have a hand in its shaping. This is one of those opportunities.
 
      This community is already in development, we have 41 acres of land in a tropical paradise (Belize), we are building treehouses, geodesic domes, aqua/permaculture gardens, earthships, sustainable energy systems, eating coconuts and mangoes, working hard, and changing the world, one pirate at a time.
 
 



WHAT WE HAVE NOW, AND WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR:
 
          We are working hard all day, every day, to build a sustainable living situation for people to come to and stay and work directly with us. And thanks to a cooperative political climate, we are coordinating with several Ministers in government to establish an industrial hemp industry here in Belize. (Among other things to be revealed as they develop on the AFMPPA facebook page.)
 
We have:
 
The land, connections, vision, passion, good luck, balls, and perseverance to make this happen, but all we need is a small amount of initial funding to allow us to make some big moves quickly, and be ready to have you and others come visit.
 
We are looking for: 
 
$1400 to transport two 4x4 trucks to Belize loaded with all the tools, solar panels, and other supplies and equipments needed to speed up the construction phase. (At the moment it's all hand tools and man power).
 
$1000 to buy two 1300 gallon water tanks to store water during the dry season for irrigation and house use. (We can pull water up from a well, but need somewhere to store it for extended periods of time).
 
$3000 to form a non-profit corporation, and register it as an NGO (Non-Governmental Organization) in Belize. 
 
$1000 Food, to feed those helping on the land to build the community structures and gardens etc. (until the gardens begin producing; 4-6 months from end of campaign if successful).
 
$600 for the initial seeds and seedlings to plant our gardens, coconut trees, banana trees, etc...
 
$1000 to hire a tractor to come out and dig our tilapia pond for the aquaculture irrigation system.
 
$1000 to hire some local workers to expedite the clearing of 5 acres to begin preparing the land for cultivating industrial hemp, and pay for the transportation of the first crop of hemp to a state of the art processing location offsite, where our hemp fibre and seeds can be milled down to the micron. 
 
$1000 to buy mosquito netting, and some materials necessary for waterproofing, and weatherproofing the first living structures" so that the initial construction crew can sleep out of the rain, and keep all the tools and gear in a dry safe place. 
 
And by the virtues of indiegogo, if we exceed the amount sought, the possibilities are endless. Before long we could begin acquiring more land into the AFMPPA offshore Trust, to preserve its natural beauty while creating more self sustained living situations, and cultivating more industrial hemp Etc. There is no ceiling. 
 
WHAT YOU GET OUT OF IT:
 
To take part in the birth of a new society and help it grow from a small collective into a worldwide movement. 
 
To have a place to stay in a self sustained eco-community in a tropical paradise. (So long as you do not violate the terms of the  AFMPPA Articles of Agreement.) 
 
To be able to certifiably call yourself a Pirate.
 
Weekly updates on the progress of the projects both on site in Belize, and elsewhere the AFMPPA takes root. 
 
To be able to say things like ... "I was there when...", and..."I was in the Academy before it was cool".
 
NOTE: Just FYI, the exchange rate in Belize is 2:1. That is, $1 USD = $2 BZD.  So all contributions will effectively equal double their ammount here in Belize.  If you can only donate a dollar,  it equals two dollars for us here in Belize. Also, paypal is the most convenient way to contribute. If you have a paypall account, we reccomend using it for these ends. Thank you.
 
 
OTHER WAYS TO TAKE PART:
 
      We are aware that some who wish to join in and become involved may not be in a position to do so financially, but never fear, there there are many other ways contribute. Here's a few:
 
--SPREAD THE WORD
Share the links to the official Facebook page of the Ancient Future Mystery People's Pirate Academy, (www.facebook.com/AFMPPA), and this indiegogo campaign everywhere you can. Talk to anyone you think may be interested in taking part in this great adventure with us. If you want more information or materials to send out, please contact us via our website www.AFMPPA.com
 
--EDUCATE THYSELF
Take some time to learn all you can about your natural rights. Teach, create, build, live, learn, love, and be a force for good wherever you go. Pull back the curtains and look at the brick wall at the back of the theatre. Poke your finger through some of the loose mortar and really see the reality of another world being possible.But most of all...
 
Be free.

story:
Short Summary

Bill Baue (author of the first Walmart Sustainability Report in 2007) and I, Tom O'Malley (Technologist) saw a demo of some software late last year that blew our minds.  In seconds, it was possible to compare entire industries for their Environmental, Social, and Governance performance, all in very easy-to-understand graphs that display absolute results and results normalized to revenue.  The owner of the software did not fully understand what they had, but Bill and I did.  We knew it had to be open to all and free.  So we contracted for the use of the software and plan to fund it by sponsors, once we get it live.  In order to make it live, we need a some start-up funds.  Thats where you can play a role.  Please help make this much needed market disrupter come to life and bring unprecedented transparency to major global industries.

What We Need & What You Get

We need bout 5k in database and front end development to make live and then another 5k to update 3 existing industries (~75 companies) and then another 5k to add 2 new industries....we will then have 5 industries completely built out.
This funding will ensure the app goes live mid June and that more content is added by end of July.
 
What you get:
All sponsors get recognized on our site and a sincere thanks for helping to change the world for the better.
All sponsors over $1000 get to a vote on our selection of industries to build out.
All sponsors over $5000 get to select an industry for build out.
 

The Impact

Though many companies report their Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) impact (about 5000), it's tough to compare performance across industry as the information often buried in sustainability reports coated in marketing jargon. What's more, the data is often reported in different units, and is sometimes calculated differently.  We make all the data easily comparable in standard units, in pretty graphs, and relative to the size of the company.  This apples-to-apples comparison in real time has never been available without paying big bucks to Bloomberg et.al., making it really hard for many to bring real context to ESG Reports.  OUR PROJECT IS A DISRUPTIVE FORCE that will improve the visibility to companies, investors, activists, employees, and consumers of the relative impact companies make.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please pass this on to multiple people who might be incented to drive free intelligent transparency into the market place.

story:
Support front lines conservation.

  

Volunteers gathering salmon feces and flesh samples from a fish farm in Clayoquot Sound. Photo: Sam Rose Phillips.

 

This year, our Going Viral project is sampling every fish farm in Clayoquot Sound for the deadly Piscine Reovirus (PRV). We’re boating out from Tofino into the Sound to collect bits of fish tissue, blobs of fat, and fish feces from the waters around salmon farms. These samples are then packaged and shipped to the lab for testing for PRV and other deadly viruses.

 

The problem with PRV

Piscine reovirus has been shown to affect chinook salmon by causing their red blood cells to explode. Southern Resident Killer Whales are starving for lack of chinook to feed on, and the government is doing everything but address the root of the problem: open-net pen salmon farming.

Farmed fish displaying classic symptoms of PRV

 

Proving that Clayoquot salmon farms are infected with PRV could be the final nail in the coffin for this industry—federal regulations prohibit the transfer of diseased fish into the ocean, and we aim to stop this practice for once and for all.

 

Get salmon farms out of Clayoquot Sound

Clayoquot Sound is the largest and most famous ancient rainforest left on Vancouver Island in British Columbia, Canada. The Clayoquot Sound blockades of the 1990s which stopped the logging were the largest act of civil disobedience in Canadian history.

'The War of the Woods' in Clayoquot Sound—Canada's largest-ever act of civil disobedience.

The nitrogen which fertilizes these magnificent rainforests comes from a marine source—in the bodies of wild salmon, when they return to their natal stream to spawn and die. Black bears, timber wolves, bald eagles and many other wildlife species feast on the salmon, spreading the nutrients far and wide.

Yet all of this is being put at risk by open-net pen salmon farms. Wild salmon runs which used to return to spawn in the tens of thousands, now only return in tens. If wild salmon go the way of the dodo, wildlife will starve and so will the forests.

The momentum has begun: the state of Washington banned salmon farms from their waters in 2018,  and then BC announced that salmon farms will be removed from the Broughton Archipelago. Clayoquot Action’s goal is to see salmon farms removed from Clayoquot Sound in 2020.

A current map of all salmon farms in Clayoquot Sound

 

You can be part of this historic movement!

Standing together for wild salmon

 

What We Need & What You Get

There is a need for funding to cover the expense of boat travel to get to remote salmon farm locations in Clayoquot Sound, as well as the cost of shipping samples to the lab for testing. For example, it costs $100 to test one sample—we are collecting minimum 3-5 samples per farm, and there are 20 salmon farms in the region. Gas costs at least $100 per trip, and we need enough funds to cover the occasional boat charter if a volunteer is not able to go at a critical time, for example when harvesting is happening.

Clayoquot Wolf by Leanne Hodges—limited edition prints are available as a perk.

Local businesses in Tofino have generously donated some fantastic perks to help raise the needed funds. Perks include stickers, art cards from local artists, t-shirts, limited edition prints of Tla-o-qui-aht artist Joe David’s Salmon People, limited edition giclee reproductions of Leanne Hodges' Clayoquot Wolf painting, and a Tofino Getaway package including three nights beachfront accommodation.

 

​Salmon People t-shirt featured in the Clayoquot Action Pack. 

 

One of the perks to support our campaign gets you a 3 night stay at Pacific Sands in Tofino. 

 

What if we exceed our goal?

A recent virus sampling mission to a salmon farm in Clayoquot Sound in partnership with Sea Shepherd Conservation Society and Tla-o-qui-aht Tribal Parks Guardians. Photo: Sam Rose Phillips

 

By joining Clayoquot Action’s Indiegogo community you will be helping to get salmon farms out of Clayoquot Sound.

Clayoquot Salmon Investigation shines a spotlight on this dirty industry. In past we have been successful in breaking media stories about Creative Salmon’s tainted bloodwater discharge into Tofino Harbour, as well as Cermaq’s harmful algae bloom, sea lion massacre, on-going sea lice epidemic (two years running), and their controversial chemical warfare to manage their sea lice crisis. We were able to pressure the BC government to investigate all pesticide use on fish farms in BC, as well as all blood water discharge from fish processing plants.

 If the goal of raising ten thousand dollars is exceeded, here are a few items from the top of our to-do list: 

$5,000 will power up our campaign to ban pesticide use on salmon farms in Clayoquot Sound.

$15,000 will power up our work to help prevent a sea lice epidemic in 2020.

$45,000 will hire a full-time CSI field and researcher coordinator for a year to help get polluting salmon farms out of Clayoquot Sound!

 

Who is Clayoquot Action?

Clayoquot Action founders Bonny & Dan are lifelong conservation veterans in Clayoquot Sound. Photo: April Bencze​

For over twenty-five years, the founders of Clayoquot Action (Bonny Glambeck and Dan Lewis) have been working to protect this awe-inspiring place from threats due to clearcut logging, industrial-scale mining, oil tankers, and salmon farming. Clayoquot Action stands for democratic rights, indigenous rights, and the rights of Mother Earth. Together with local volunteers and backed online by people around the world, we run strategic, people-powered campaigns to help Clayoquot Sound remain one of the most beautiful places left on earth.

 

What is Clayoquot Sound?

Meares Island Tribal Park in Clayoquot Sound - ​Photo: Sander Jain

 

Clayoquot Sound UNESCO Biosphere Reserve near Tofino BC is the Last Great Rainforest on Vancouver Island—world famous for monumental cedars, bears, wolves and whales. Clayoquot Action recognizes and supports the indigenous rights and title of the Hesquiaht, Ahousaht, and Tla-o-qui-aht First Nations—stewards since time immemorial of the lands and waters now called Clayoquot Sound.

 

Wild salmon are the lifeblood of these ancient forests and cultures, providing food, livelihoods and fertilizing the ecosystem which sustains life.

 

Want to learn more?

Each sample we send to the lab to test for viruses costs $100

 

Check out SalmonPeople.ca and take the Wild Salmon Pledge. We’ll keep you up to date on the latest developments, and alert you when you can take specific actions to help protect wild salmon.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Follow Clayoquot Action on social media. Please help us promote this campaign—share this page with your family and friends!

- Clayoquot Action on Instagram

- Clayoquot Action on Facebook

- Clayoquot Action on Twitter

So many wildlife species depend on wild salmon! Tofino Photography 

A CSI volunteer operating an underwater camera at a salmon farm in Clayoquot Sound

Co-founder Bonny Glambeck collecting samples at a fish farm near Tofino, BC. Photo: Sam Rose Phillips.

April Bencze reviews images captured at a salmon farm in Clayoquot Sound

story:
Hello, my name is Spencer James and I am figuring out how to fix up the atmosphere.  You may not see the pollution or the contaminants choking our resources and lungs when you look outside your home, but there are places on this earth, such as I have seen in China, where you cannot see the outside at all — no Sun, not the mountains surrounding the city, or even the color blue.  I intend to develop an atmospheric air-filtration system, as you would think of it in your home, and to take that remedy one step further.  By not just removing hazardous chemicals from the atmosphere, but by also replacing them with ozone and oxygen to make the atmosphere healthier, happier, and more productive.  To do this, I need time to research, design, and engineer a solution for our problem and for that, I will need your help.  Starting today, on this very page, you can contribute to the effort and participate in finding the answer!

   This is the Sun, high in the afternoon sky, as seen — or barely seen — in Beijing, China around 4pm on a Thursday afternoon.  Beijing is one of the world's worst cities in terms of air quality and this picture depicts what is known as a good day for the area.  Yet Beijing isn’t the only problem.  My concern is the spread of contaminants over the entire surface of the planet; low visibility is not the only symptom of pollution.  

   Invisible dirt is just as harmful as dirt which you can actually see.

   Clean air not only looks clear, but it feels good too.  Breathe air from a mountaintop or choke on the fumes of a dying world, which would you rather?  Help return our sky to a beautiful clarity, like this scene in Mongolia, a skyline left completely untouched.

      Although air-filtration is available and in use at the point of exhaust on many automobiles and factories, these efforts are privatized and particular to the offending source.  The goal of this campaign is not to target a few problem areas, but to design a system capable of taking in all pollutants, capturing those deemed unfit for public consumption, and replacing them with refined, breathable, oxygen-rich air.

   The best part of this system is the opportunity to make the atmosphere even better by replacing filtered chemicals and gasses with ozone and oxygen.  Ozone, you may remember, protects the planet from harmful radiation and naturally converts itself to oxygen in the upper atmosphere.  Oxygen, which we humans often prefer to breathe, is an important gaseous mineral and fuel.  Oxygen, naturally present in the air is sometimes forgotten as a main ingredient for combustion, such as the propellants of cars, jets, and rockets.  With more oxygen in the atmosphere, the air itself is more reactive, allowing for hotter, faster burns, more efficient engines, and shorter travel times.  Oxygen is also one of the main elements in many organic reactions.  The era of dinosaurs witnessed an atmosphere rich in oxygen, providing plentiful resources for giant plants and animals to thrive.  Placing more oxygen in the atmosphere allows more frequent biologic reactions with flora and fauna, yielding larger crops, produce, and livestock as well as humans!  An oxygenated environment on Earth is only the beginning.  Imagine the opportunity future applications of this system will bring to currently inhospitable planets such as Mars, Venus and others yet undiscovered.

   Creating this future is my career and this Indiegogo campaign is responsible for generating the entirety of my operating budget.  This budget covers all our overhead, which, beyond manpower, includes all equipment, utilities, research materials, lab space, transportation, and so on.  This funding affords us the precious time needed to bring a new system, these new technologies, and policy modifications into reality.  Contributors of $99 or more will not only receive peace of mind and hope in a better tomorrow for all mankind, but exclusive content and insight into the work in progress.  Please, use the link at the top of the page to make your contributions today.


Thank you!

Like these images? 

You may also support the effort by purchasing wallpapers from the IWGBTP store: www.spencerjames.me

      Although air-filtration is available and in use at the point of exhaust on many automobiles and factories, these efforts are privatized and particular to the offending source.  The goal of this campaign is not to target a few problem areas, but to design a system capable of taking in all pollutants, capturing those deemed unfit for public consumption, and replacing them with refined, breathable, oxygen-rich air.



   The best part of this system is the opportunity to make the atmosphere even better by replacing filtered chemicals and gasses with ozone and oxygen.  Ozone, you may remember, protects the planet from harmful radiation and naturally converts itself to oxygen in the upper atmosphere.  Oxygen, which we humans often prefer to breathe, is an important gaseous mineral and fuel.  Oxygen, naturally present in the air is sometimes forgotten as a main ingredient for combustion, such as the propellants of cars, jets, and rockets.  With more oxygen in the atmosphere, the air itself is more reactive, allowing for hotter, faster burns, more efficient engines, and shorter travel times.  Oxygen is also one of the main elements in many organic reactions.  The era of dinosaurs witnessed an atmosphere rich in oxygen, providing plentiful resources for giant plants and animals to thrive.  Placing more oxygen in the atmosphere allows more frequent biologic reactions with flora and fauna, yielding larger crops, produce, and livestock as well as humans!  An oxygenated environment on Earth is only the beginning.  Imagine the opportunity future applications of this system will bring to currently inhospitable planets such as Mars, Venus and others yet undiscovered.


   Creating this future is my career and this Indiegogo campaign is responsible for generating the entirety of my operating budget.  This budget covers all our overhead, which, beyond manpower, includes all equipment, utilities, research materials, lab space, transportation, and so on.  This funding affords us the precious time needed to bring a new system, these new technologies, and policy modifications into reality.  Contributors of $99 or more will not only receive peace of mind and hope in a better tomorrow for all mankind, but exclusive content and insight into the work in progress.  Please, use the link at the top of the page to make your contributions today.

Thank you!



Like these images? 
You may also support the effort by purchasing wallpapers from the IWGBTP store: www.spencerjames.me

story:
Climbing, not cutting.

For people who live in South American rain forests, wild palm trees provide important nutrition in the form of fat-rich fruits. Traditionally, people looped a sling around their feet and climbed to harvest these fruits, sometimes high above the forest floor. But, this climbing tradition is in decline. Cutting palms down to take their fruit is a destructive shortcut now prevalent in the Amazon and beyond. If people lack climbing skills or tools, they may have no choice but to chop.

Our project*, developed over years of partnership with rain forest peoples, provides a solution: a new kind of climbing gear. We also promote traditional climbing techniques – which many young people have lost – but our innovative gear design works especially well when palms are slick, very tall, or large in diameter. It's yet another way to get up to the fruit. We hand make the gear using an unusual stiff rope that makes climbing easy.

Our goal is to fund 150 sets of climbing gear delivered with appropriate training to people in the rain forest by the end of July. But the real demand for the gear far surpasses that, and this project scales up smoothly. We could efficiently place much more gear with people we will train to use it in rain forests from Guyana to Colombia, from Brazil to Peru—in all countries where these wild palms are important. 

We know that the current trend of cutting palms down for their fruit is not sustainable. Together we can blend old and new traditions of climbing to improve rain forest stewardship. Now it's up to you.


*sponsored by Caura Futures, Inc., a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization. _________________________________________________________

The music used in the video, "Hidden Blues" by pitx is licensed via Creative Commons: Pitx / CC BY 3.0

story:
Who are we?

WAF is a non-profit NGO that aims to raise awareness about global water and food challenges, highlighting successful stories and most importantly, provides the missing link between these initiatives and the resources they need to grow.

WAF promotes and celebrates sustainable initiatives that improve water and food security in some of the earth's poorest regions.

If you want to know more about us visit our webpage www.wafaward.org.


Why did we set up this campaign?

The world has enough water and food to meet everyone’s needs. Yet over 750 million people lack access to clean water, and nearly 900 million are undernourished worldwide.

Every year, at our annual award event, WAF joins together businesses and individuals with the very best initiatives that have proven to be sustainable, locally-owned and are able to grow to have a greater impact on a larger scale.

We are trying to make the most out of an amazing opportunity to promote what works, at our 2014 Award Event in London. This world stage provides the most exposure for global water and food challenges and their solutions, and gives the opportunity that this year's successful finalist initiatives need and truly deserve. 

This is only possible through donations, partnerships and passionate volunteers and we believe that we can make a difference by acting together to solve the world's water and food challenges.

We need your help to accomplish this goal together!


Why do we need your donation?

We have an enormous amount of ambition and we are trying to recruit big companies that can give our initiatives the resources they need to grow. However, we are a young organisation and companies are not interested unless we have a proven track record.

Your donations will allow us to bring this year's 5 finalists representatives to the event award, where they will have this huge opportunity to engage businesses and individuals to support them provide food and water to more and more people!

With a small contribution you can make a big difference!


Which ground-breaking initiatives are you helping with your donations?

The Centre for Holistic Management, Zimbabwe

Reversing Desertification

By applying natural processes, the initiative stops desertification and protects livestock. In fact, the herds become efficient agents of soil regeneration leading to rehabilitation of ecosystems.


Growing Power, Milwaukee


From Malnutrition to Healthy Eating

Up to 50,000 people annually benefit directly from the services, which include healthy meals to local schoolchildren. Local youth from the centers also visit the schools to showcase the initiative accomplishments and to promote healthy eating.


Living Lands, South Africa

Baviaanskloof Mega-Reserve Restoration

More than 1,000 hectares have been reforested; five rivers and alluvial areas have been restored. All land users have signed onto a land-use change map, which addresses Payments for Ecosystem Services (PES), carbon credits, eco-tourism, restoration, and sustainable food production.


MS Swaminathan Research Foundation, India

Holistic Farming

Mobilization has empowered community groups to increase holistic agricultural production, improve water harvesting structures, and stimulate local enterprise.


SEANET education, Kenya

e-Gardening

11 schools and 4,035 students accessed clean water and healthy food. They also developed students’ food production and processing skills.


With your donation, you can help!


And finally... help us spread the word!

story:
Short Summary

I am a college student. I want to change the world. Sounds cliche doesn't it? Well I don't want to be just another failed dreamer-- I want to do something about it. The state of this world isn't going to change unless more people get up, make an effort, and follow through on what they believe in. I believe that the tropical rainforests of Central and South America are worth preserving. Hopefully you do too.

Please help me raise funds to go to Central America and get hands-on experience on how to help this endangered ecosystem. Currently, I am working towards a double major in Environmental Science: Ecological Restoration and Environmental Management and Protection: Natural Resources Planning. However, an in class instruction can only go so far. I need more practical knowledge of the rainforest and the people that live there if I wish to truly make any sort of difference. I've already been accepted to a 12 unit summer abroad program in Belize which promises to provide not only a rigorous ecological curriculum, but to take me backpacking across the country to visit indigenous peoples, snorkel in the second largest coral reef in the world, rehabilitate jaguars, conduct environmental impact assessments, and more. I am really excited for this opportunity to become more involved with the world that I care about so much and would really appreciate some help in getting to my destination.

Here is a link to my study abroad information: http://wildlandsstudies.com/index.php/belize-ecosystems-cultures


What We Need & What You Get

What I need is help paying for this trip. I've been working towards it since I first heard this opportunity existed, but even two jobs a semester does not do much when they are minimum wage and worked around a full-time college schedule. Thankfully, next semester, I will have a job writing a grant for the Humboldt Energy Independence Fund for the glorious amount of $10/hr with flexible, independent research hours. With your help, I really think that I can do this.


I've copied from the study abroad website the projected fees for this trip. I have already paid the application fee. As you may notice, the list does not include gear which, considering the majority of this trip will be out in the forest backpacking, I will also be purchasing. It also does not mention travel insurance which is also required (my research indicates that that will be about $300 as will the gear).

Belize Program Costs, Summer 2014

   $  150      Application Fee
   $3650      Program Fee
   $2400      Estimated In-Country Group Fee
   $  750      Estimated Airfare/Visa
   $  800      Estimated Food Money/Personal Spending
   $7750     Total Estimated Cost

  Summer 2014: Program fees due by May 1, 2014

As you can see, this trip is a little pricy. However, I truly believe that it is what I need in order to get the environmental experience that I desire. I do not want to spend my entire undergraduate and graduate career working towards some abstract, hypothetical goal. I want to touch the forest; see what I'm fighting for. I want to know that which I strive for.

If you help me, I shall be most grateful. So grateful I'll give you something even! I appreciate every single contribution and therefore anyone who donates will be individually thanked.

  • $10: A picture from my trip of your category choosing (anything to do with the rainforest, coral reefs, Mayan temples, or Belize City)
  • $25: 5 Pictures and Baked Good
  • $35: Cute Cat Video (or other video type of your choice)
  • $50: I will put your name on my forehead for a day.
  • $75: I will henna your name to my arms. Lasts much longer than a day!
  • $100: A compilation album of all the glorious sites from my trip, organized and labeled just for you.
  • $150: Stuffed animal of your choice, with personalized bandana, is sent straight to you.
  • $250: Bag of Mystery. Ooooh. Goodies glore! 
Gifts are further described under "Perks."

The Impact

The point of this project really is to make an impact. Not only will I be gaining the tools with which to advocate for rainforest preservation, but I will be doing practical conservation work on this very trip. To save the rainforest, all sorts of people are needed. People who have the funds to help from home (you), people that have the knowledge and time to help on site (my goal), people that have the mindset to help at the market (buyers of sustainably sourced goods), ect, ect, ect. Everyone can help. If more people were to learn about the rainforest -- what it is, what it does for us, what is happening to it -- I believe more people would believe that this is a cause worth helping. Please, encourage anyone you know to do a simple google search on rainforest destruction and read one of the articles that comes up; do it yourself even. In the search I just conducted, the very first site says, "one and one-half acres of rainforest are lost every second" and that "experts estimate that we are losing 137 plant, animal and insect species every single day due to rainforest deforestation." 50,000 species a year. Rainforests are home to over half of the world's ~10 million species, and they're dying. Yet, rainforests and the biodiversity within provide us so very many benefits. They give us more than 20% of our oxygen, 20% of our fresh water, 25% of Western pharmaceuticals, 60% of our diet. The U.S. National Cancer Institute has identified approximately 3,000 plants that are active against cancer cells -- 70% of which are only found in the rainforest. The tropical rainforest is absolutely  necessary. Yet some people just don't see. Please help me help them see.



Other Ways You Can Help

If you can not provide money right now, I completely understand. However, if you still want to help, I would ask that you post my link on your Facebook or other social media site to help me get the word out. Advice on backpacking and/or camping goods would also be appreciated. When you do have more funds, I highly encourage donating to a charity involved in helping the rainforest. Or, if you come into a lovely inheritance before June 23rd, feel free to fling as much of it at me as you want-- I'll still be in town (and most likely putting up another campaign after this one expires as they have only a 60 day project limit) Search for me ;]

story:
A group of friends raising money for conservation through education in our home country of Zambia.

We are a group of friends and colleagues, who have entered the notable and adventurous Elephant Charge race in Zambia. On September 28th we will navigate the Zambian bush - at our own expense - in a 4x4 that we have built ourselves. As participants, we have pledged a minimum of $1,000 - ALL of which will go to conservation in Zambia, with a focus on conservation through education. All beneficiaries are legitimate conservation organisations across Zambia such as Conservation Lower Zambezi, Children in the Wilderness, and Game Rangers International.

We will get our vehicle and asses busted on the grueling course through the wild bush, but it's all worth it if you can help us bring money to the beautiful and important natural resources of Zambia.

While there's plenty of competition in a) being able to complete the wild course and b) finishing the course in the shortest possible distance, the biggest competition is on which team can raise the most money for conservation. So please help us, help Zambia and help the world by donating to our campaign!

Team Popcorn for the win!

THE TEAM
Niels Bojsen
The palest boy in Zambia, with a heart of gold and the drive to get us through this challenge. From Denmark and currently investing in growth businesses in Zambia.

Peter Bojsen
The second palest boy in Zambia and the younger brother of Niels. Definitely the mechanical brain of our team, who will be able to lift us through the course with his strength and bush manners. From Denmark and currently working to grow businesses with his brother in the Northwestern Province of Zambia.

Tue Andersen
The back-up mechanic, daredevil, and true pioneer on our team, who always goes all in. From Denmark and in love with Zambian businesses, buildings, and his wife.

Peter Bwalya
The optimist on our team, who will carry the mood with his smooth, joyful, and always chatty demeanor. From Zambia and leading the way for creating sustainable businesses in Zambia.  

Alexandra Frank
The sailor from Denmark, who's excited to finally get a map in her hands to navigate through the landlocked country that is Zambia. Currently a mother, consultant and rocking radio hostess.


Sam Singh
A former professional captain from India, who spent his childhood in Zambia and Canada and currently lives between London and Kitwe as a manufacturer of metal balls. Sam will take on any challenge thrown at him because, well, he's got balls of steel!

 

HOW THE FUNDS ARE SPENT

The teams that enter the Elephant Charge make a pledge to the conservation charities and every single dollar that the teams raise is passed directly to the Zambian beneficiary charities as grants. The money needed to put on the Elephant Charge competition itself is raised by the organising committee and comes from charge sponsors and a small entry fee paid by each team.

The beneficiaries make grant applications each year and are selected based on the programs and projects thats they propose which are best placed to deliver on the Elephant Charge mission of conservation through eduction in Zambia. The beneficiaries prepare reports on how the funds have been spent through the year so that the Elephant Charge and the teams can be sure on how the money raised is spent.

story:
Beginning a journey...

Fauna in Focus is a new environmental awareness project for northwest Cambodia. Born from the 2011 award-winning Nosy Maitso film, we are setting out to produce an educational video on wildlife conservation in Cambodia.

  • Our Cambodian Nature Film will introduce Cambodia's unique biodiversity and will teach audiences about sustainable conservation and community conservation projects around the country.
  • The film will be narrated entirely in the native Khmer language, with English subtitles, and will be distributed freely online, as well as to thousands of local schools, NGO projects, rural communities and conservation organizations working in the region.
  • You can help! Wild animals and ecosystems in Cambodia are vanishing. With your support we can bring engaging environmental education to the people who matter most, and change their perceptions towards wildlife and conservation.
Become a part of wildlife conservation in Cambodia!

    Cambodia's unique biodiversity is facing many threats from illegal logging and hunting, to unsustainable agriculture. From big cats to vultures, the unique biodiversity of Cambodia is in trouble, but you can do something about it! 

    Your donations will:

    • Raise awareness and appreciation of Cambodia's unique biodiversity.
    • Improve local knowledge of conservation projects and sustainable practices.
    • Help reach audiences across the country and around the world.

A small donation can go a long way in Cambodia!

    Fauna in Focus hopes to raise $15,000 to make a film unlike anything ever made for Cambodian audiences! To make this film a reality we need film assistants, field guides, equipment and expeditions to film in some of the most remote and unexplored regions of the country.

    • $5,200 : Staff - For filming and production over a 6 month period we need translators, a director/editor, a local film assistant and the occasional forest ranger or camera crew!
    • $2,700 : Equipment - A new zoom lens, two new microphones, a new slider and hopefully a DJI Phantom Pro 3!
    • $4,000 : Expeditions - Our team will visit community forests and conservation projects throughout northwest Cambodia, from Tonle Sap Lake and Phnom Kulen National Park, to the dry forests of Preah Vihear and Oddar Meanchey province. This will cover park entry fees, transport and vehicle rentals and much, much more!
    • $3,100 : Production - By December 2015, Fauna in Focus aims to produce at least 1,000 DVDs for distribution to local schools, NGOs and conservation projects across the northwest. In addition the film will be available online for free.
    • Extra $$$ - Any additional funds raised beyond our target goal will be put towards production of additional DVDs or our Fauna in Focus Community Wildlife Workshop programs.
    If we do not reach our target goal on Indiegogo, never fear! We will continue with production as best we can, and will hold additional fundraising events to cover any shortages.
The Fauna in Focus team
    Producing the film will be a collaborative effort between numerous biologists and filmmakers working in Cambodia. The project will also provide jobs for local field guides, film assistants and translators. Fauna in Focus is partnering with existing organizations like the Wildlife Conservation Society, Birdlife International, and Wildlife Alliance to highlight the important work they do. 
    The project director, Daniel Roper-Jones, is a primatologist, environmental educator and filmmaker who has lived in Cambodia for over two years. While working in Madagascar he produced an educational film called Nosy Maitso which received an award from the International Wildlife Film Festival in 2011. The Cambodian Nature Film will be even better!
How else can I help?

    No money, no problem! Please remember that even a small donation can help, but there are plenty of other ways you can support our other awareness campaigns:

    • Share this Indiegogo page with colleagues, friends and family.
    • Like and share the Fauna in Focus Facebook page.
    • Donate photos and videos that we can use in our educational programs.
    • Design or share exciting lessons plans or activities on wildlife and ecology.
    • Volunteer your time and expertise to help with fundraising for Fauna in Focus.
    Visit our website at www.faunainfocus.org to learn about our our other environmental awareness campaigns and how you can get involved!

    Cambodia's wildlife says:
story_txt:
Beginning a journey...
Fauna in Focus is a new environmental awareness project for northwest Cambodia. Born from the 2011 award-winning Nosy Maitso film, we are setting out to produce an educational video on wildlife conservation in Cambodia.

Our Cambodian Nature Film will introduce Cambodia's unique biodiversity and will teach audiences about sustainable conservation and community conservation projects around the country.

The film will be narrated entirely in the native Khmer language, with English subtitles, and will be distributed freely online, as well as to thousands of local schools, NGO projects, rural communities and conservation organizations working in the region.


You can help! Wild animals and ecosystems in Cambodia are vanishing. With your support we can bring engaging environmental education to the people who matter most, and change their perceptions towards wildlife and conservation.

Become a part of wildlife conservation in Cambodia!



Cambodia's unique biodiversity is facing many threats from illegal logging and hunting, to unsustainable agriculture. From big cats to vultures, the unique biodiversity of Cambodia is in trouble, but you can do something about it! 
Your donations will:



Raise awareness and appreciation of Cambodia's unique biodiversity.

Improve local knowledge of conservation projects and sustainable practices.

Help reach audiences across the country and around the world.





A small donation can go a long way in Cambodia!

Fauna in Focus hopes to raise $15,000 to make a film unlike anything ever made for Cambodian audiences! To make this film a reality we need film assistants, field guides, equipment and expeditions to film in some of the most remote and unexplored regions of the country.


$5,200 : Staff - For filming and production over a 6 month period we need translators, a director/editor, a local film assistant and the occasional forest ranger or camera crew!

$2,700 : Equipment - A new zoom lens, two new microphones, a new slider and hopefully a DJI Phantom Pro 3!

$4,000 : Expeditions - Our team will visit community forests and conservation projects throughout northwest Cambodia, from Tonle Sap Lake and Phnom Kulen National Park, to the dry forests of Preah Vihear and Oddar Meanchey province. This will cover park entry fees, transport and vehicle rentals and much, much more!

$3,100 : Production - By December 2015, Fauna in Focus aims to produce at least 1,000 DVDs for distribution to local schools, NGOs and conservation projects across the northwest. In addition the film will be available online for free.
Extra $$$ - Any additional funds raised beyond our target goal will be put towards production of additional DVDs or our Fauna in Focus Community Wildlife Workshop programs.
If we do not reach our target goal on Indiegogo, never fear! We will continue with production as best we can, and will hold additional fundraising events to cover any shortages.

The Fauna in Focus team

Producing the film will be a collaborative effort between numerous biologists and filmmakers working in Cambodia. The project will also provide jobs for local field guides, film assistants and translators. Fauna in Focus is partnering with existing organizations like the Wildlife Conservation Society, Birdlife International, and Wildlife Alliance to highlight the important work they do. The project director, Daniel Roper-Jones, is a primatologist, environmental educator and filmmaker who has lived in Cambodia for over two years. While working in Madagascar he produced an educational film called Nosy Maitso which received an award from the International Wildlife Film Festival in 2011. The Cambodian Nature Film will be even better!




How else can I help?

No money, no problem! Please remember that even a small donation can help, but there are plenty of other ways you can support our other awareness campaigns:

Share this Indiegogo page with colleagues, friends and family.

Like and share the Fauna in Focus Facebook page.

Donate photos and videos that we can use in our educational programs.
Design or share exciting lessons plans or activities on wildlife and ecology.
Volunteer your time and expertise to help with fundraising for Fauna in Focus.

Visit our website at www.faunainfocus.org to learn about our our other environmental awareness campaigns and how you can get involved!




Cambodia's wildlife says:

story:
Short Summary

At Mount Vernon Presbyterian School we were given the opportunity to "make a dent" anywhere in the world. As we explored compelling global issues, water scarcity kept striking us as the most salient issue affecting our world. Recently, the Philippines were hit with a devastating typhoon.(stat of killing/left wtou water) We did some research, and found that Lifestraws can filter out over 99% of all waterborne bacteria and viruses. We came in contact with International Relief and Development (IRD). They were exited to hear about our project, and are working with us to send LifeStraws to families in the Philippines. There are millions of people without clean drinking water in the Philippines and we want to help. We need your help to raise money to help "make a dent" in the Philippines.  

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need $5,000 dollars to buy about 56 family LifeStraws. This will help 56 families of 5 for 3 years! Cleaning 99.99% of bacteria a viruses out of their water!
  • We can help 280 people!!! 
  • We are not just giving Filipino families clean water, but also spreading awareness on the importance of clean water
  • These funds will go to the International Relief and Development, a nonprofit that will buy LifeStraws and transport them to families in the Philippines

The Impact

Your contributions will allow us to help families in need of clean water in the Philippines. We hope that by making this "dent" we will encourage other students to help people in need not only in our country, but also around the world. We need you to help us reach this goal and possibly save many lives from being taking by contaminated water. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We appreciate anything you can contribute, and if you can't there are other ways to help us:

  • Spread the word! Tell your friends, family, co-workers, etc. about us.
  • Share the link via Twitter, Facebook, email, and any social media outlet!   

Thank you so much for your help! We appreciate your contributions and support.

story:
Congratulations!

You just completed Level 1: Finding your way to our project page. You can now watch our teaser video above in order to complete Level 2. It will give you the building blocks you need for the rest of the game. Yes, the adventure has already begun...

Gameplay

To spice up the experience, interact with our project by completing the 4 levels on this page. 

Your Heroes

You’re looking here at a team of 6 -quite awesome- social entrepreneurs, with a vision and a mission to accomplish. Compostory.org is a freshly established nonprofit organization with big plans! Let us tell you a bit more about it.

 

Challenge!

You know the challenge now:

As of today, too few cities are reaping the insane benefits from recycling their organic waste. In 2013, most cities around the world have yet to take advantage of their “waste”. Organic waste often accounts for more than two thirds of the total waste landfilled.

When food waste is disposed in a landfill, it rots and becomes a major source of methane – a potent greenhouse gas with more than 20 times the global warming potential of CO2. In the US, the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) estimates that diverting organic waste from landfills will avoid 6.3 million metric tons of methane per year in the country, the equivalent of keeping 24 million cars off the road each year!

(Yes, that’s scary… Level 3 – What’s your reaction? ReTweet to educate your friends:
“In the US, diverting all organic waste from landfills is the equivalent of keeping 24 million cars off the road each year! #compostory @compostoryorg”
Don’t have twitter? You can share your reaction at feedback@compostory.org )

In the Driver’s Seat…

In the driver’s seat: Local governments. They need our help! It’s time to start cashing in that treasure that keeps building on.

It's much easier for municipalities to make things happen if they get clear answers to all the legitimate questions they ask themselves:

                  

And that’s the problem: Most cities don’t know the answers to those questions:  Nobody is knocking on their door to bring them up to speed. So they do nothing, but the clock is ticking.

Waving a Magic Wand?

Ok, so we need to help local governments understand what they can do with organic waste, and urgently at that. Fortunately, there is a lot of knowledge in the field already and enough success stories. The problem is that it’s quite difficult (even discouraging) for a project team who is getting started to access proper content on the topic. The existing knowledge could be much better packaged and distributed, using the digital formats we can leverage today.

That’s the big idea: The best knowledge in the field needs to be turn-key, on-demand, and only one click-away from anyone anywhere. And it shouldn’t cost anything, so everyone can understand the basics and get the big picture. Makes sense?

This is where we step in!
Our expertise is in Digital Media & Education and today we are in the position of catering to this global need.

A Learning Center, Online

Yes, we can change the game by developing and aggressively marketing a catalog of free online courses for cities to learn more about recycling organic waste.

The courses will feature video formats showcasing industry experts discussing success stories and teaching the basics. The goal is to create awareness, get the participants excited about the opportunities and provide them with all they need to SHAKE THE ROOM at their next meeting!

 (Level 4 – SHAKE THE ROOM! and join our community or room shakers: Take 5 seconds and give us a “like” on http://www.facebook.com/compostory.org )

Own a Piece of the Solution…And Get Your City Onboard!

Of course, we want you on the team.
With your help, we can make this project happen and knock on the door of 200 cities worldwide to distribute a first set of online courses. And because we want you to co-own this, we offer you the opportunity to add the city of your choice to the distribution list! In other words, you become an influencer…

Or?

Or we’re in bad shape…
The Research & Development part of this project is being financed by a sponsor but we are still missing the budget for production and distribution. If we don’t raise all the money in this campaign, we won’t be able to deliver the unique content we are developing.

How to Join Our Quest?

Whether it’s spreading the word via social media, telling the story to your mother, or donating a few bucks, your participation is a must! And we came up with great perks for you.

Take one last look at the scary data above, but don’t fret! Breathe deeply, put your hand on the mouse, and help us do something about it!

Thank you for your help!

                       

 

Video animated by Fenja Heijkenskjöld fenjaheijkenskjold.com/ 
Script by Fenja Heijkenskjöld & Camille Duran
Soundtrack by Thomas Chrysochoos
Special thanks to Rachel Skaarup
Copyright © 2013 Compostory.org. All Rights Reserved.

story:
Aromaste' Clinical Aromatherapy

Kate O'Hara, Clinical Aromatherapist, Essential Oil Educator

I am the owner of a small Aromatherapy business in the beautiful Finger Lakes Region of Upstate New York. Passionate about alternative healthcare and concerned for my health and the health of my family, I decided to obtain a formal education in Aromatherapy. I graduated from the Aromahead Institute of Essential Oil Studies in Ithaca, NY as a Nationally Certified Clinical Aromatherapist and wish to share my expertise with all who wish to empower themselves. The entrepreneur in me is looking to continue creating my gorgeous 100% VEGAN product line in order that others may benefit from Aromatherapy as I have. I am a stay at home mother of four beautiful children who were my inspiration at the beginning of this journey. In searching for alternative health care I was introduced to essential oils. I intially used them to treat my own anxiety and then I used them to eliminate allergies and help with skin conditions my children had been dealing with. They were so effective I wanted to study essential oil chemistry and learn as much as I could. This began my passion and led me to persue this dream. This business provides a unique service to those seeking environmentally friendly products that are good for our bodies and our environment. All classes will be offered on a sliding scale in order that this information is accessible to everyone. My therapeutic essential oil product line that is 100% VEGAN will be available to help all via my website this fall. My dream is to expand this business from beyond trade shows and craft fairs. My desire is to offer custom therapeutic consultations and workshops. I have paid for my education and financed my business start-up with small business loans thus far. I need your help to allow me to purchase ethically sourced essential oils on a larger scale. They can be quite expensive. I really wish to expand my product line, teach more classes and bring this amazing healing art to all. Thank You. In exchange for your generous contribution I am offering amazing perks.

Aromaste Clinical Aromatherapy Products:

Top 10 (Vegan)

1. Aromatherapy Custom Roll-on Formulas: Headache, Slumber, Anxiety, Meditation, Wild Woman, Immunity, Joy, Aprodisiac

2. Rosewater: Versatile rosewater toner for gorgeous skin, wrinkles, anti-aging *may also be used on baby's bottom as a gentle effective wash

3. Aromaste's Signature Blend Massage Oil: A relaxing and joyful blend of essential oils in a grapeseed base. My families favorite.

4. Sweet Sugar Rose Body Polish: exfoliating and invigorating scrub and moisturizer to be used in shower or bath. Leaves you smelling and feeling gorgeous!

5.  Vegan Coconut Lime Lip Balm: A tropical treat for your lips made with extra virgin organic coconut oil and essential oil of lime. Delish.

6. Jojoba Face Lift in a Bottle: organic jojoba oil is combined with a proprietary blend of essential oils to create my daily moisturizer and skin protectant. Simple and highly effective. a little dab and your skin will glow. My daily go to!

7. Epsom Salt Detox Bath Blend: epsom salts and essential oils to soothe an achey body and pull out toxins.

8. Sweet Dreams Lotion: lavender and chamomile essential oils in a lucious cream that may be applied before bed for kids from 1 to 92.....zzzzzzzzzzzzzzz

9. Diaper Rash/Multi-purpose Skin Salve: a pushup stick of essential oils, skin protecting oils with a bit of candelilla wax for baby's bum, burns, bruises and more. The mama's always come back for this product.

10. Bug Off!: child safe, non toxic super effective bug/insect repellent spray

The $9000.00 will be utilized for the supplies needed to custom blend for my clients and continue creating my product line. More funding will really make this business happen in a more impactful way. It will allow me to offer more classes where I discuss the toxic effects of products we use every day. I will continue to empower my students through education to create their own skincare products using essential oils as well as replace the common household toxic cleaners that cause cancer, anxiety, fibromyalgia, allergies, asthma and a mulititude of health problems. I will teach parents how to help themselves and their children effectively through the therapeutic use of essential oils. Knowledge is power and we owe it to ourselves to live long healthy lives free from disease.

Where the money goes:

$ 4000.00 to purchase ethically sourced essential oils and other natural ingredients to make products......essential oils can be very costly. Did you know it takes 60,000 roses to make 1 pound of rose essential oil? 

$ 1500.00 for containers made in the USA 

$1500.00 for graphic design, web page creation advertisement

$ 2000.00 for Advanced Graduate Program and Medicinal Blending coursework at the Aromahead Institute, The more I learn the more I can share! Education is key.

$500.00 for miscellaneous start up fees (including postage to mail your perks)

The Impact

When you contribute, you are helping me fund my dream. You are assisting an educator/ entrepreneur expand upon a unique, Eco-friendly business that offers a valuable environmentally conscious service. We need more alternative healthcare options. I love teaching and I wish to continue to help families struggling with health issues that I eliminated in our family. As a clinician I am able to create effective, affordable, therapeutic products. To those of you who are frustrated with our current health care system, Aromatherapy may be for you in combination with other alternative modalities or by itself. If you or a loved one are being treated unsuccesfully with pharmeceuticals, please consider essential oils. When you contribute you receive an Aromatherapy Perk in exchange for your generous contribution! All products are custom blended by me. I am so appreciative for anything you are able to contribute.

My Testimony 

Essential Oils and Aromatherapy changed my life and enabled me to take care of my anxiety and other health related issues as well. Allergies were eliminated as I created non-toxic products for use with my four children. Throughout my studies I learned how to create non-toxic effective alternatives to replace my cleaning products. I wish to share aromatherapy with others.

Please share my campaign on all of your social networks to get the word out with anyone you believe may benefit from my eco-friendly products and services.

Please use the Indiegogo share tools, facebook, twitter, email........

~ Aromaste'

story:
Mahalaya is a Sanskrit word derived from Maha meaning "Great" and Alaya meaning "the abode" or "Soul of the World". Together it translates as "The Great Abode, The Grand Residence, or The Dwelling of the Great Soul.



Vision

Imagine a world where money was no longer the means of exchange of services but rather love, knowledge and enthusiasm as its primary exchange. A world full of love and so much diversity that each individual's enthusiasm became the driving force behind one's life work and one's life work was as distinctive as one's own fingerprint. A world where every job and every service had its own caretaker that performed its tasks with so much love and care they freely wanted to giveaway these services. Tell me? What would this world look like? A world of harmony and service where all needs were met and provided by someone that was just as equally grateful to give as well as they were ready to receive. A world of haves without the not's. A world of abundance without the lack. A world of love without the suffering.

Can you imagine this?


Impact

We stand at a critical moment in Earth's history, a time when humanity must choose its future. As the world becomes increasingly interdependent and fragile, the future at once holds great peril and great promise. To move forward we must recognize that in the midst of a magnificent diversity of cultures and life forms we are one human family and one Earth community with a common destiny. We must join together to bring forth a sustainable global society founded on respect for nature, universal human rights, economic justice, and a culture of peace. Towards this end, it is imperative that we, the peoples of Earth, declare our responsibility to one another, to the greater community of life, and to future generations.

Earth, Our Home

Humanity is part of a vast evolving universe. Earth, our home, is alive with a unique community of life. The forces of nature make existence a demanding and uncertain adventure, but Earth has provided the conditions essential to life's evolution. The resilience of the community of life and the well-being of humanity depend upon preserving a healthy biosphere with all its ecological systems, a rich variety of plants and animals, fertile soils, pure waters, and clean air. The global environment with its finite resources is a common concern of all peoples. The protection of Earth's vitality, diversity, and beauty is a sacred trust.

Mission

Mahalaya is an eco-spiritual sustainable community and educational center created as a blueprint of sustainable conscious living in harmony with the Physical, Mental and Spiritual nature of man and the planet. Recognizing that we are in defining moment of our planets history, we are dedicated in becoming a leader in building a global sustainable society founded on respect for nature, universal human rights, economic justice, and a culture of peace. 

Providing a sustainable living environment for individuals and families the community will facilitate research and development, social and educational programs in following areas:
1.    permaculture 
2.    ecology
3.    green technologies
4.    green living
5.    holistic studies
6.    metaphysical studies (non-denominational ancient wisdom teachings)
7.    vegetarian, vegan and raw food living


Community Infrastructure

  1. Green Technology Research Center
  2. Alternative Energy (Geo-Thermal, Solar, Hydro)
  3. Permaculture Gardens
  4. Sustainable Green Homes based on Sacred Geometrical Patterns
  5. Apartment Co-housing
  6. Two Healing Centers
  7. 2-3 Hotel Retreats
  8. Birthing Center
  9. Primary and Secondary Schooling
  10. Healing Spa
  11. Indoor/Outdoor Amphitheatre
  12. Community Center
  13. Parks
  14. Crystal Gardens
  15. General Holistic Stores
  16. Organic Farm
  17. Two Temples (east/west)
  18. 100 single family homes


The Mahalaya community and resort will include an architectural infrastructure that utilizes sacred geometrical patterns, bio-mimicry and permaculture practices and principles.



















What We Need & What You Get

We are  currently looking to raise initial start-up capital of $10,000 to establish our non-profit organization, and hire the necessary legal representation. We are unable to disclose the location yet but we are in the process of securing over 1000 acres in a tropical setting and will begin designing the community immediately. We have many volunteers from permaculture designers and sustainable architects, engineers waiting to begin work on the project once the organization has been securely established.


For all those that donate we will provide discounted rates for all our future educational classes.


Other Ways You Can Help

Be the change you want to see the in the world and help spread our campaign to your friends family!


Deep Thanks and Gratitude!
story_txt:
Mahalaya is
a Sanskrit word derived from Maha meaning "Great"
and Alaya
meaning "the abode" or "Soul of the World". Together it translates as "The Great Abode, The Grand Residence, or The Dwelling of the
Great Soul. 



Vision


Imagine a world
where money was no longer the means of exchange of services but rather love,
knowledge and enthusiasm as its primary exchange. A world full of love and so
much diversity that each individual's enthusiasm became the driving force
behind one's life work and one's life work was as distinctive as one's own
fingerprint. A world where every job and every service had its own caretaker
that performed its tasks with so much love and care they freely wanted to
giveaway these services. Tell me? What would this world look like? A world of
harmony and service where all needs were met and provided by someone that was
just as equally grateful to give as well as they were ready to receive. A world
of haves without the not's. A world of abundance without the lack. A world of
love without the suffering. 


Can you imagine
this? 

Impact
We stand at a critical moment in Earth's history, a time when 
humanity must choose its future. As the world becomes increasingly 
interdependent and fragile, the future at once holds great peril and 
great promise. To move forward we must recognize that in the midst of a 
magnificent diversity of cultures and life forms we are one human family
 and one Earth community with a common destiny. We must join together to
 bring forth a sustainable global society founded on respect for nature,
 universal human rights, economic justice, and a culture of peace. 
Towards this end, it is imperative that we, the peoples of Earth, 
declare our responsibility to one another, to the greater community of 
life, and to future generations. 
Earth, Our Home

We are unable to disclose the location yet but we are in the process of securing over 1000 acres in a tropical setting and will begin designing the community immediately. We have many volunteers from permaculture designers and sustainable architects, engineers waiting to begin work on the project once the organization has been securely established.

For all those that donate we will provide discounted rates for all our future educational classes.
