story:
Ten years ago, 40 families who had lived on, worked on, and loved the land bought Finca la Florida to own for themselves. Their purchase gave them power—the power to run a business their way. La Florida produces organic coffee, bananas, macadamias, and honey that are tastier and more healthful for their customers and better for the environment. With the power to keep their own profits, the people of la Florida have reinvested those savings in the community to improve their living and working conditions, found a school for its children, launch an ecotourism program, protect the rain forest ecosystem, and set aside for the future.

But on November 8 a magnitude 7.4 earthquake less than 100 km (60 miles) away ravaged la Florida. Ten families’ homes need serious repair. A wall fell in La Casa Grande, the community center which houses visitors’ rooms and the school. Most devastatingly, other damage is preventing la Florida from running its business. A water pipe that is crucial for processing coffee beans has broken. Many young coffee trees (almácigo) are hurt, and damage to bee housing has caused an 80% loss of honey.

Why Give to La Florida?

La Florida needs your help! Although the people of la Florida have made immense progress building a strong business and community, they do not have the resources to recover from such a blow alone. This earthquake has destroyed much of their work and threatens their future wellbeing. 

Donating to la Florida makes a long-term impact. You are investing in the enduring empowerment of its people. Everything they have achieved, they have achieved in conditions that are physically, politically, and financially more difficult than most of us have ever faced. Now this natural disaster has made those conditions so much worse—but you have the power to give them a fighting chance again.

What’s more, La Florida has a strong tradition of ethical responsibility. Businesses in Central America commonly ignore the best interests of social justice and the environment in order to squeeze the most profit possible out of a property. But the people of la Florida have faith in a better system.  Your donation supports their community values and sustainable, conscientious treatment of the land that they love—their home.

What Will My Donation Do?

Leaders at la Florida have reported the following breakdown of needs:

  • $1,400 to replace destroyed bee hives, which have resulted in an 80% loss of honey
  • $1,500 for ten 8-inch PVC pipes and $75 for glue to replace a broken water pipe crucial to coffee bean processing
  • $2,000 for 50 4x4s and $525 for 36 2x2s to repair 10 families’ homes and the coffee processing building 

Why Give Now?

The sooner la Florida has the funds to repair the earthquake damage, the sooner everyone will be living in safe shelters and producing organic goods to support themselves once more.

But giving now also takes advantage of the holiday season! If you’re unsure of what to give your loved ones—or if you want to present them with a truly meaningful gift—donate to la Florida in their honor. Nothing tells a person that he or she brightens your life better than a donation that passes on your blessing and improves other lives.

You can also ask your loved ones to donate on your behalf! Avoid receiving material gifts that you don’t much like or intend to use by requesting a donation to a cause that is important to you.

Check the list of perks on the right to see which ones bests suit you and your list of gift recipients this holiday season.

Where Can I Learn More?

Visit FincalaFlorida.com for more photos, videos, and information, including the lowdown on visiting and volunteering and the experiences of visitors from all over the world. Friends of la Florida who have come to love the community have also made a Facebook group that all are welcome to join—“Me Encanta Finca La Florida, Guatemala!” (“I Love Finca la Florida,” or literally “Finca la Florida Enchants Me”).

Better yet, visit la Florida yourself! Your support of their ecotourism program means more to them now than ever.

 How Can I Spread the Word?

Share a link to this page on Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, Pinterest, and any other social media sites you use! Tell friends, family, and anyone interested in the environment and social justice to check out our campaign. Finally, ask for donations in your honor in lieu of material gifts this holiday season.

Every bit of attention helps, and every donation—no matter how small—makes a difference in the lives of the hardworking people of Finca la Florida. On their behalf and on behalf of those who have come to love them, ¡gracias por su apoyo! Thank you much for your support! 

Who made this page? My name is Katie Barnes, and I created and manage this campaign page with help from other supporters of la Florida. (My pictures show me picking coffee beans off the trees and one of the kids we met at la Florida!) I have visited la Florida twice, first with my older daughter in 2007 and then again in 2011 with my younger daughter. I wanted both of them to have the great experience!  I have supported la Florida since that first amazing visit and hope to return to see them again soon. I was horrified at the news of the earthquake and joined forces with some others from Me Encanta Finca La Florida, Guatemala! on Facebook to help our Guatemalan friends get back on their feet.

If you have any questions or want to hear more about my experiences with la Florida, please feel free to e-mail me at katiebarnes@swbell.net. ¡Gracias por ayudarnos! Thank you for helping us!
